summary: If you're a self-starting and detail-oriented Accounts Receivable (A/R) Clerk, we might have a job for you! This is a short-term temporary-to-full-time Accounts Receivable Clerk position and is based in the Fresno, California area....
description:
If you're a self-starting and detail-oriented Accounts Receivable (A/R) Clerk, we might have a job for you! This is a short-term temporary-to-full-time Accounts Receivable Clerk position and is based in the Fresno, California area. Accountemps is partnering with a growing Manufacturing company who is seeking an Accounts Receivable (A/R) Clerk to join the accounting team. The Accounts Receivable Clerk's duties will be to enter, post and reconcile batches, research and resolve customer A/R issues, prepare aging report, place billing and collection calls, maintain cash receipts journal, update, and reconcile sub-ledger to G/L. This position is for candidates who are looking for career growth potential, and who are capable of processing 200+ invoices per week.

Responsibilities

- Sort out payments and compile segments of monthly closings and annual reports in compliance with GAAP

- Contact clients to help resolve payment issues; assist in setting up payment plans

- Execute a number of foundational accounting tasks in agreement with normal procedures, including general accounting tasks

- Locate delinquent customer accounts through various means, e.g. skip-tracing, phone contact, written correspondence, and make arrangements for payment

- Confirm documents and codes

- Balance bank accounts, posting and balancing financial data in a number of different ledgers

- Be an ambassador of the mission, values, and culture of the organization

- Present information, as requested to shippers, customers, the sales/marketing department and other stakeholders 
 - Observant, accurate and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment

- Demonstrated analytical skills in basic accounts receivable and accounting policy

- General proficiency in Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel preferred

- AA or BS/BA degree in Accounting or related field

- Knowledge of credit collections

- Solid understanding of accounts receivable

- Proficient in ERP systems

- 2+ years of relevant experience in accounts receivable

summary: Our client, located in the Windsor area, is currently seeking a Procurement Customer Support Agent to join their team!   The Procurement Customer Support Agent position is a critical one to the operations team in the Supply Chain department...
description:
Our client, located in the Windsor area, is currently seeking a Procurement Customer Support Agent to join their team! 

The Procurement Customer Support Agent position is a critical one to the operations team in the Supply Chain department and is an immediate need. The Procurement Customer Support Agent obtains requirements by verifying, preparing, and forwarding purchase orders for the organization and is responsible for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) from customers. This position reports directly into the Production Manager. 

The primary responsibilities of the position are as follows: 
• Managing the Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) for customers; 
• Processing orders; order entry 
• Verifies purchase requisitions by comparing items requested to master list; 
• Scheduling delivery; prepares purchase orders by verifying specifications and price; 
• Respond promptly to customer inquiries 
• Handle and resolve customer complaints 
• Obtaining approval from requisitioning department; 
• Resolves shipments in error with suppliers; 
• Resolve Accounts Receivable issues 
• interfacing with the Production Planners; customer relations and order entry into their ERP system. 

The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years in a procurement support or manufacturing customer service role, intermediate excel skills including pivot tables and v-lookups and excellent organizational and communication skills. 

If you meet these qualifications and are interested in this opportunity, please apply today, email [email protected] or call Accountemps at 860-278-7170! 
 The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years in a procurement support or manufacturing customer service role, intermediate excel skills including pivot tables and v-lookups and excellent organizational and communication skills.

summary: If you have a background in accounting and you're interested in taking on a challenging Full Charge Bookkeeper role with opportunity for advancement, this job may be for you. If you're comfortable with preparing and processing financial...
description:
If you have a background in accounting and you're interested in taking on a challenging Full Charge Bookkeeper role with opportunity for advancement, this job may be for you. If you're comfortable with preparing and processing financial statements and accounts and managing all general accounting and bookkeeping essential functions, you might be the Full Charge Bookkeeper Accountemps is looking for. The strongest candidates for this position will have excellent organizational skills, strong communication tactics, and the ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines. This long term temporary Full Charge Bookkeeper position is located in North Brunswick, New Jersey.

What you get to do everyday:

- Tracking fixed assets to produce depreciation schedules

- Managing accounting clerks and entry-level bookkeepers

- Maintaining knowledge of current federal, state, and local legal requirements, ensuring adherence to them, filing reports, and communicating with management on needed actions

- Performing reconciliations for bank and general ledgers, as well as payroll processing

- Putting together the trial balance and financial statements, including balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statement

- Ensuring monthly, quarterly and year end close happens accurately and on time

- Handling processing tasks for accounts payable and accounts receivable, including collections

- Carefully filing documents to preserve historical records

If you are interested, please email your resume to Amanda Powell at [email protected] 
 - Excel, Quickbooks, and Peachtree experience a plus

- Highly organized, attentive, has a sense of urgency, flexible and able to deal with frequent interruptions and changing priorities

- 3+ years of bookkeeping experience

- Can work independently with minimal supervision

- Proven flexibility to adapt to changes in procedures and job assignments

- Experience with payroll preferred

- Knowledgeable of accrual and cash basis of accounting

- Competence with financial data analysis and report generation that is prompt and accurate

- Deep understanding of account reconciliation

- Financial statement preparation experience

- Bank reconciliations experience preferred

- Ability to multitask and meet deadlines

- High school diploma or similar accreditation, and an AA degree or higher in Accounting or Business recommended

Provides technical assistance and support for incoming inquiries, requests, and issues related to hardware, software, network connectivity and application support 
Ensures users/customers are provided with professional, courteous, and timely support and service

Bookkeeper job duties include working closely with our accounting team to create and analyze financial reports and ensure legal requirements compliance, process accounts payable and receivable and manage invoices and tax payments. Our ideal candidate holds a Finance degree (preferably followed by accounting CPE courses) and is familiar with accounting software packages, like FreshBooks, Kashoo and KashFlow.

Ultimately, the Bookkeeper’s responsibilities are to accurately record all day-to-day financial transactions of our company.

Record day to day financial transactions and complete the posting process

Perform partial checks of the posting process
Complete tax forms
Enter data, maintain records and lunch reports and financial statements
Process accounts receivable/payable and handle payroll in a timely manner

 Bilingual is a English and Spanish
Experience with Quickbooks is a must

Work would include preparing correspondences, drafting legal memoranda and pleadings, filing/e-filing with courts, preparing deposition and trial exhibits, running conflict checks, managing case files, ordering medical documents and police records, entering time and monthly billing, and other administrative tasks as needed. 

This full-time Legal Secretary role is ideal for someone who enjoys multitasking, is extremely organized and has a real passion for the legal field.

- Order reports, medical records and bills

- Under attorney supervision, be able to handle assigned files and deliver legal services

- Prowess with word processing and spreadsheets highly sought after

- Able to manage time well

- Solid understanding of personal injury plaintiffs

- Background working with federal courts

- Command of medical malpractice

- Adeptness in calendar managements and scheduling appointments

- Proficiency in medical records

- Practical knowledge of drafting

- State courts experience highly preferred

- General familiarity with editing

- Trial preparation experience highly desired

- Demonstrated knowledge of proofreading

- Foundational knowledge in Discovery

summary: OfficeTeam has an excellent career opportunity for an articulate, highly-skilled Quotation/Order Specialist . Do you love building solid customer relationships? Then this position may be for you. This position will operate in a fast-paced...
description:
OfficeTeam has an excellent career opportunity for an articulate, highly-skilled Quotation/Order Specialist . Do you love building solid customer relationships? Then this position may be for you. This position will operate in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. This Deer Park, Texas Customer Service Representative position could be for you, if you're available for a long-term temporary opportunity.

What you get to do every day

The Aftermarket Center (AMC) Customer Fulfillment Contractor will be responsible for all activities from inquiry to remittance for orders. This includes facilitating customer transactions, quoting, order management, and overall customer service. 
• Own quotation, order management, post-shipment, and overall customer issues resolutions throughout all phases of the business cycle for parts. This includes but not limited to reviewing and providing recommendation on customer requirements to assure compliance and/or noted exceptions on quotations / purchase orders 
• Manage and resolve commercial and technical risks. Includes review, negotiation and escalation of supplier’s commercial terms and conditions 
• Review and approve pricing and delivery schedules for quotations and orders pricing based on level of authority 
• Determine and approve where parts are sourced for customer specific orders by researching BHGE factories and 3rd Party Vendors inventories to determine best availability to meet customer deliverables 
• Autonomously review and issue purchase orders for customer specific orders directly to suppliers 
• Manage shop fulfillment prioritization of customer specific orders 
• Facilitate order entry, provide order status updates, resolve customer issues and attend customer meetings where necessary 
• Manage blocked / hold orders and maximize on-time delivery through constant communication and prioritization of the shop fulfillment 
• Manage customer satisfaction surveys, follow-ups and associated corrective actions 
• Work in close partnership with sales teams on customer related issues 
• Collaborate with leadership for all necessary process improvements 
• Manage escalations from external customers through AMC by clear communication, influencing teams and prioritization of activities 
• Manage and Update ERP system when necessary 
 - Excellent verbal and written communication skills

- Proficient with computers and technology platforms

In this role you will be responsible for receiving and processing payments, posting payments and adjustments, ensuring payments are applied to outstanding balances and analyzing Explanation of Benefits to ensure accurate postings. To get in consideration for this role apply today at Accountemps.com or email your resume to [email protected] 

Responsibilities: 
- Analyze paper EOB to ensure accurate posting of payments and adjustments.
- Investigates the source of unidentified payments to ensure payments are applied to appropriate accounts.

- Scan all cash posting documents that are required into the electronic document system.
- Provide suggestions related to process improvement as appropriate.
- Clearly identify and report balancing issues to the department supervisor.
- Performs daily cash posting and reconciliation of electronic and manual payments.
- Responsible for retrieving payer remits from various websites for posting. 
- Knowledge and understanding of electronic system posting logic. 
 - High School Diploma or GED
- 2+ years experience in healthcare industry
- Transaction posting and daily reconciliation processes
- Must be able to analyze trends that are seen from different payors and make recommendation
- Attention to detail and transaction accuracy is required

description:
There is an opening for a Payroll Administrator at Accountemps, for candidates who have proficiency with Microsoft Office applications. This might be the right opportunity for your career if you can handle a dynamic work environment that requires strong communication skills and problem-solving abilities. The Payroll Administrator will be a part of a dynamic team with an opportunity for career growth. Based in Romulus, Michigan, the Payroll Administrator position is a long-term temporary-to-full-time opportunity.

What you get to do every single day

- Exercise of proper data management by collecting, calculating, and entering payroll data

- Establish payroll liabilities after calculating all employee federal and state income and social security taxes and employer social security, unemployment, and worker compensation payments

- Manage employee deductions and other liabilities

- Supporting all internal and external audits related to payroll

- Report changes where necessary after maintaining payroll operations via company policies and procedures

- Handle payroll discrepancies through information collection and analysis

- Preparing relevant weekly, monthly, quarterly and year-end reports for circulation to department heads

- Updating payroll records by entering changes in exemptions, insurance coverage, savings deductions, and job title and department/division transfers

- Ensuring compliance with federal and state regulations and guidelines

- Other duties as assigned

- Secure confidential payroll operation information and maintain employee confidence

- Manage payroll information requests and questions

- Organize and compile summaries of earnings, taxes, deductions, leave, disability, and nontaxable wages in order to draft relevant reports

- Perform review and verification of source documents 
 - Previous experience handling high volume multi-state payroll, billing, licensing, AP, etc.

- Relevant experience should include 2+ years in payroll

- Experienced in basic accounting principles and solid financial acumen

- Prior experience working with collections/accounting software

- Excellent analytical, quantitative and social skills

- Certified Payroll detail oriented will be given preference

- Accurate, swift, data entry abilities

- Knowledgeable about federal and state payroll regulations and requirements

- Proficiency in benefits payroll

- In-house payroll experience

- Knowledge of Microsoft Excel

- Solid understanding of Oracle HRMS

- Mastery of internal controls

description:
To be a good fit for this Payroll Administrator position, you should have experience with Microsoft Office and be ready for a challenge. If you're looking for work as a Payroll Administrator, Accountemps is looking for candidates with dynamic communication and problem-solving skills who can process payroll effectively and efficiently. If you want to work in a fast-paced environment, contact us today to start advancing your career with this smart team. This Payroll Administrator opportunity is located in Yonkers, New York and is a long-term temporary-to-full-time role.

Your responsibilities

- Draft relevant year-end reports, as well as weekly, monthly, and quarterly ones, for department heads

- Retrieve and assess information in order to resolve payroll discrepancies

- Secure confidential payroll operation information and maintain employee confidence

- Handle other duties as necessary

- Maintaining payroll operations by following policies and procedures; reporting needed changes

- Enter changes in exemptions, insurance coverage, savings deductions, and job title and department/division transfers as part of managing payroll records

- Deliver assistance to payroll with internal and external audits

- Able to reconcile employee deductions and other liabilities

- Managing payroll information by keeping proper records for collecting, calculating, and entering data

- Answer questions and requests related to payroll information

- Preparing reports by compiling summaries of earnings, taxes, deductions, leave, disability, and nontaxable wages

- Certify compliance with federal and state regulations and guidelines

- Establish payroll liabilities after calculating all employee federal and state income and social security taxes and employer social security, unemployment, and worker compensation payments

- Manage and review, including verify, source documents

FOR CONSIDERATION EMAIL ME AT [email protected] 
 - Remarkable analytical, quantitative and social skills

- Reliable skills in Microsoft Office with excellent Excel skills

- 3+ years of relevant experience in payroll

- Prior experience working with accounting software

- Proficiency in ADP Trading

- Ad Campaigns experience desired

- Knowledge of 3D CAD

- Outstanding data entry skills

- Mastery of internal controls

- Knowledgeable of basic accounting principles and solid financial acumen

- Capable of managing high volume multi-state payroll, billing, licensing, AP, etc.

- Understanding of federal and state payroll regulations and requirements

- Certified Payroll Professional designation favored

The Patient Account Representative - Cash Posting provides administrative support to the cash posting operations within the assigned function(s). The incumbent performs the timely and accurate posting of electronic and manual cash receipts, denials and adjustments to patient accounts. 

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Under general supervision, post routine electronic and manual cash receipts, adjustments and denials; ensuring reconciliation of all posted data,
Balance electronic and manual cash receipts through the generation and analysis of necessary reports; resolving outstanding variances, errors and issues, 
Refer to assigned work lists in the identification and resolution of routine transactions within the assigned function(s), 
Perform all responsibilities in compliance with company policies and procedures, 
Assist with various projects as assigned by direct supervisor.
Other duties as assigned. 
 EDUCATION:
High School Diploma required 

EXPERIENCE AND REQUIRED SKILLS: 
Good computer skills with working knowledge of word processing spreadsheet and email applications, 
Detail oriented with good analytical and organizational skills, 
Good interpersonal skills with the ability to work cohesively within a team environment, 
Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively communicate with all levels of management. 

If interested please email a current copy of your resume to [email protected]

Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to: 

- Preparing correspondence for attorney review
- Typing/proofreading legal documents
- Managing time entries into TimeSlips legal software
- Tracking and maintaining attorney's calendars and emails
- Assisting with travel arrangements 
- Preparing and submitting expense reports 
- Filing electronic and paper documents and filing in court and/or the electronic filing system 
- Scheduling meetings as needed
- Preparing closing binders
- Reception duties as needed 
 High Proficiency needed in: 
-Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, Adobe
-Filing and E-Filing
-Timeslips

If you feel as if you meet this background and are interested in hearing more about this position, please send a word version of your resume to [email protected]

I look forward to hearing from you! 
 Located in major North American and global markets, Robert Half Legal is the premier provider of legal staffing and consulting solutions on a full-time, project, and temporary basis, serving both law firms and corporate legal departments. We also provide project and eDiscovery teams and workspace for a wide range of initiatives, including litigation support, mergers and acquisitions and document review matters. Our dedicated teams' industry experience allows us to quickly match skilled legal professionals with the best available jobs. We offer challenging opportunities, competitive compensation and benefits, and skills-enhancement training.

Call your local Robert Half Legal office at 888.490.5592 to discover more about this position. Apply for this job now or contact our branch office for additional information.

description:
Immediate Opening for Jr. Financial Analyst (hybrid support with Accounts Payables to Finance Dept.)
 This position is of a Project-like nature with a high opportunity to Extend; includes Benefits; M-F; standard business hours. Position Requires a Degree in Finance or Accounting. Proficiency with Excel (vlookup and pivot tables). Experience with any ERP software is needed. And proficiency with English and Spanish (oral and written). 
 This hybrid role is responsible for full-cycle payment processing and issues bank account deposits. In addition, analyst duties collecting data on A/P payments processed, reporting on status and discrepancies and other related information. Reports to Director of Finance and supports Finance department and managers.This role requires high attention to detail. Reporting via Excel; use of an ERP software (Great Plains preferred). And requires the ability to communicate in both English and Spanish (proficient / oral and written) to correspond with clients, vendors or other locations throughout Latin America (LATAM). Insurance related experience is a plus. 

Pay varies on experience during the initial project; and offers training throughout the learning curve and significant growth.

Please submit your resume directly to [email protected] 
 Degree in Finance or Accounting
Excel (vlookup and pivot tables)
Any ERP software (Great Plains, Oracle, SAP, Peoplesoft etc.)
Proficiency with English and Spanish (oral and written)

description:
This SCHEDULING COORDINATOR will provide clerical support to a very busy medical office. This SCHEDULING COORDINATOR will use their clerical abilities to answer and screen incoming phone calls, document patient and doctor information, and enter patient information into relative computer systems. If you have a background in administration and like to stay busy on a daily basis, we would love to hear from you!

POSITION DETAILS
Handle incoming phone calls 
Document insurance information for patients and doctors
Enter updated patient data into relative computer system
Handle a consistent flow of patient phone calls and communication 
Resolve patient questions and inquires 
Provide general clerical duties as needed 

For immediate consideration, email resume to: [email protected] 
 REQUIREMENTS
Previous experience in medical office administration, customer service, call center or related experience
Great phone communication skills for helping patients
Work well in fast paced office environment
Accuracy when entering data into computer systems 
Ability to resolve and diffuse patient situations 
Medical background a plus 
**Schedule will be Evening Hours

OfficeTeam is currently working with a growing Title company in the Galleria area of Houston, TX! We are seeking an experienced Escrow Assistant on a temporary to full-time basis. Job duties for the Escrow Assistant include:

- Assist Closers with ordering mortgage payoff statements, HOA Documents/estoppels, tax statements

- Complete applicable events in Archer and documenting notes in Archer and SoftPro
- Document packages client 
 Requirements for the Escrow Assistant:

- 3-5 years of experience as an Escrow Assistant
- Experience working with pre-closing and post-closing escrow responsibilities
- Skilled in Microsoft Office Suite
- Excellent written and verbal communication 
- Ability to multitask

summary: Accountemps has an Accounts Payable (A/P) Clerk opportunity in a stimulating work environment with a team of highly skilled professionals. In this position, you will be required to manage all general administrative needs of the AP/Finance...
description:
Accountemps has an Accounts Payable (A/P) Clerk opportunity in a stimulating work environment with a team of highly skilled professionals. In this position, you will be required to manage all general administrative needs of the AP/Finance Department. You will work closely and report to the Accounting Manager. Matching and batching code, resolving A/P issues, processing expense reports, updating and reconciling sub-ledger to G/L and processing checks are integral functions for this position. Join a fast-growing team in this exciting job opportunity that offers career growth. Located in Dallas, Texas, the Accounts Payable Clerk will be a long term temporary opening.

****If you are interested and your experience matches the qualifications, please email your resume to [email protected]****

How you will make an impact

- Verify, log and mail checks, including expediting special handling

- Provide support to internal business partners

- Produce full-cycle A/P

- Sort, log, scan, and file invoices, checks, and other documents

- Facilitate internal and external audits as needed

- Perform daily processes and controls correctly and punctually, ensuring company policies are followed

- Handle the administrative needs of the AP/Finance Department

- Open, sort, and distribute daily department mail

- Perform special projects as assigned 
 - Excellent attention to detail

- Working knowledge of spreadsheets and databases

- Account reconciliation experience

- Foundational knowledge in testing

- Comprehensive knowledge of accounts payable

- Proficiency in bank reconciliations

- Proven knowledge of Oracle

- Experience with Ariba

- Prior experience in an A/P role preferred

- Demonstrated communication, customer service, and interpersonal skills, especially with both technical and financial backgrounds

- AA or BS/BA degree in Accounting, Business or similar preferred

****If you are interested and your experience matches the above qualifications, please email your resume to [email protected]****

description:
Robert Half is seeking a Customer Service Specialist ideally with call center/phone call background to work for one of our clients in the Brickell area. If you have prior experience working at a bank, insurance company or call center environment, please apply to this role. 

[email protected] 

This position is responsible for handling clients highest level of customer concerns to ensure they are resolved in an efficient and timely manner. Customer Service Specialist provide knowledge and expertise to all customers and business partners to effectively resolve any service-related concerns. The Customer Service Specialist must balance both the needs of the customer and the business while supporting service recovery initiatives through three focus areas: research, service (via phone, chat, email, text message), and operations. 

•	Research, analyze and resolve customer (internal and external) concerns in an accurate and timely manner by using appropriate tools and resources to assess situations and create resolutions that are appropriate 
•	Maintain constant ownership of workload by managing emails, social media, chat, and text messages for areas of responsibility to ensure response time goals are met 
•	Assists in the development, testing, and communication of operational policies and procedures by identifying service problems and assisting with root cause analysis 
•	Establishes and maintains positive working relationships with coworkers and partners 
•	Must maintain up-to-date skill set 
•	Maintain confidentiality 
•	Other duties as assigned 

[email protected] 
 QUALIFICATIONS 
•	At minimum of 1 year of Customer Service experience 
•	Customer focused with the ability to work effectively and professionally with both internal and external partners 
•	Ability to perform work activities requiring instructing, persuading or speaking with others 
Situational analysis and risk mitigation skills 
•	Ability to maintain professionalism without disruption to the operation, employees, or customers 
•	Track record of exhibiting good judgment, common sense and problem-solving skills 
•	Ability to assess the customer and adjust communication style accordingly 
•	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite 
•	Excellent interpersonal skills 
•	Self-motivated 
•	Ability to work in high pressure environment 
•	Strong organization skills with attention to detail 
•	High School diploma, GED, or equivalent business experience required 
•	Willingness to learn and receive new information

summary: If you're looking to build your career in accounting, there's currently a long-term temporary Staff Accountant position in the Non-Profit industry with Accountemps that you may want to check out. The Staff Accountant is responsible for...
description:
If you're looking to build your career in accounting, there's currently a long-term temporary Staff Accountant position in the Non-Profit industry with Accountemps that you may want to check out. The Staff Accountant is responsible for preparing journal entries, monthly and year-end closings, bank reconciliation, fixed asset maintenance, and general ledger reconciliation. During the monthly close, many aspects of internal reporting will be your responsibility. You will assist with the development and implementation of accounting policies. In addition, you will take part in compliance, review schedules for the reporting processes, and interact with our external auditors for quarterly reviews and annual audits. A highly involved position, it works to produce Financial Statements, Cash Flow projections, and Budgets. Based in the San Diego, California region, this company offers an engaging and multifaceted opportunity where effort is rewarded.

Major responsibilities

- Complete month end close, journal entries, without supervision

- Maintain intricate journal entries and account reconciliations including but not limited to cash, prepaid expenses and payroll

- Help with the implementation, maintenance and adherence to internal controls and accounting procedures ensuring compliance with GAAP

- Be a part of various department-wide initiatives

- Commentate on a wide variety of financial data and communicate it in a useful and understandable manner

- Keep up fixed asset ledger, depreciation, and reconciliation

- Manage capital lease and monthly payment schedules

- Ad-hoc tasks and special projects, as needed

- Assist in the month end, quarter end and year end closing process including monthly financial close workbook preparation

- Create monthly statement analysis to be used for management reportings 
 - Self-starter and strong ethical standards

- 3+ years of recent and relevant accounting experience

- Strong attention to detail

- Deep understanding of journal entries

- Bank reconciliations experience

- Knowledge of accounts receivable

- Solid understanding of account reconciliation

- Experience with month end closings

- Competent with spreadsheets and databases

- Ability to work within spreadsheets and databases

- Current and relevant ERP system experience

- experienced organizational, written and verbal communication skills

- Ability to prioritize work and balance multiple projects and deadlines

- Exceptional analytical, quantitative and social skills

- BA/BS or equivalent in Accounting, Finance or Economics

- Experience working in a dynamic and changing company environment a plus

description:
A Peninsula based law firm is looking for a helpdesk support analyst. This person will be primarily responsible for the internal support of PC hardware and software, audio and video conference set up with Cisco products, and mobile device support. You will also need to complete new installations by using Firm standard configurations for desktops and laptops using SCCM. 

This law firm has offices across the US, Europe, and Asia. Here locally in the Bay Area, they have locations in San Francisco and Palo Alto. This position is based out of Palo Alto, but on rare emergency occasions, some support may be necessary in San Francisco (reimbursement included for any travel between offices). You will be the sole helpdesk support analyst for the Palo Alto location. 

To be successful in this position you will need to have audio/video conference set up experience (Cisco products), you will need to have experience with PC hardware and software set up and support, you will need to be a self starter and prioritize tickets accordingly, you will also need to have excellent interpersonal communication skills and keep composure under stressful time constrained situations.

If you are interested in hearing more about this position, please send a resume to [email protected] with your favorite Marvel character in the subject line. 
 - Audio/video conference set up experience (Cisco products)
- PC hardware and software
- Law firm experience is a HUGE plus
- 2+ years of experience
- VOIP

description:
****If you have an interest in this opportunity, please send your updated resume directly to Ashley Conley at [email protected] Following up with a phone call is highly encouraged. Please call 630-368-0316 and ask for Ashley Conley to follow up.

Robert Half Technology has an Application Support Specialist III opportunity available with a premier client located in Buffalo Grove, IL. This will be a 6 month contract to hire position.

Overview:
Responsible for the support of applications/systems/database and third party software programs. Deploys the release of re-designed modules, upgrades and new technologies as well as design, install, configure, and maintain supported software. Ensure that deployments will successfully migrate in to production without faults. Resolve immediate issues related to data and programs and coordinate with the development staff or vendor support to handle more complicated problems. Resolve issues regarding operations, including installations, setups, error messages, on-line transactions, system status and downtime procedures, etc. Ensure end user satisfaction by providing preventative maintenance, troubleshooting and quickly resolving problems.


Responsibilities:
•	Technical Support: Under general supervision, respond to and research and resolve routine to moderately complex issues with internal applications/systems and/or databases. Implement short term solutions for quick resolution of issues and begin to develop long term solutions to problems that occur. 
•	Communication: Provides input to peers, management and clients for recommendations and alternate solutions and/or improvements. Conveys problems, solutions, updates and project status to their peers, clients and management. 
•	Documentation: Document support issues and solutions. Prepare design documentation for all maintenance programming and/or re-development/enhancement/patches. Prepare and maintain deployment documentation for internal applications/systems/database and/or third party vendor packages.
•	Monitor the call-tracking queue for incoming cases. Assess and prioritize issues. Determines when escalation is necessary.
•	Troubleshoot client/user reported issues that pertain to our custom or 3rd party business applications by researching programs, data and application setups. Record Resolution.
•	Assist clients/users in creating and analyzing reports. Gather information necessary to arrive at resolution by generating reports, creating subsets of data and interfacing with users.
•	Guide clients/users through established resolutions. Gather information necessary to arrive at a resolution. 
•	Perform tests on problems reported by clients/users. 
•	Act as a liaison between clients/end users, internal developers, and QA groups.
•	Partner w/QA in testing
•	Assist in training clients/end users on software.
•	Document tasks and activities that are used to resolve issues in order to enhance the overall knowledge database used by the rest of the support team.
•	(Level III) Mentoring: Takes responsibility for personal and team technical and professional growth. Assists junior level app specialists with understanding and applying procedures, methodologies, tools, utilities and standards. Serve as a resource and provides on-the-job training and advice on tasks to be accomplished by less knowledgeable or newer associates. Provides technical assistance and follow through to team members.
•	Performs other related duties and participates in special projects as assigned. 
 •	4-yr college degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or equivalent experience is required
•	Level III - 5-7 years supporting computer applications.
•	Light development experience a plus.
•	In depth knowledge of SQL, relational database query tools using Microsoft SQL Server 2008, 2012, etc.
•	Experience supporting websites/Microsoft .NET custom applications
•	Working knowledge of the software development life cycle. Exposure to a formal Project Management methodology
•	Able to demonstrate good problem-solving skills and appropriately apply proven solutions. 
•	Consistently deliver prescribed outcomes in a timely and accurate manner with appropriate guidance. 
•	Apply existing processes and procedures to solve problems and may receive guidance for problems that are non-routine.
•	Ability to utilize infrastructure software and Microsoft Office Suite.
•	Experience in inventory/order management systems environment is preferred. 
•	Knowledge of IT security relevant to data protection and data integrity.
•	Proficiency in English
•	Customer Service Orientation. Communicate effectively verbally and in writing.
•	Ability to work individually and in a team environment.
•	Skilled at issue identification and resolution. Strong data analysis and problem solving ability.
•	Detail oriented with excellent time management and organizational skills to meet critical deadlines.

description:
Help Desk Analysts will be interested in this Robert Half Technology opportunity! This long-term temporary employment opportunity is based in the New York, New York area. If you have a can-do attitude and are looking to be part of a highly motivated team, you'd be great for this position! If chosen, you'll be handling complex end-user support issues and providing support to team members by focusing on restoring service to the end users. It is also important for you to understand how your role as the Help Desk Analyst relates to IT projects and IT Service Management initiatives. Another important piece of knowledge candidates should have is an understanding of Incident, Problem, Change Management and other processes. It is also important for you to understand how these processes work together to provide superior support and high availability of our business. This is the perfect Service Desk Analyst job for you if you want to represent the Service Desk by liaising with 2nd and 3rd level teams to help transition new and changing services. This position could certainly have duties including creating knowledge articles and arranging training for other Service Desk Analysts when needed. The responsibilities for this Analyst job can sometimes include covering alternative shifts when needed. We encourage any applicants who fit the description of a self-confident, motivated person with a strong work ethic and excellent communication skills who enjoys a fast-paced, team-driven environment.

Key responsibilities

- The chosen candidate will need to facilitate user account management. That means onboarding, change and departure processes

- Maintain hardware and peripherals: Responsible for upgrading and replacing computer parts; handle documentation and asset inventory

- Understand concepts related to networks, servers, PCs, databases, proprietary systems, etc.

- Troubleshoot end user issues: Provide root-cause analysis on various web and mobile applications; handle escalated tickets relating to server/network related issues

- Understand and utilize ITIL processes (Incident, Problem, Change, etc.) and how they are used in a corporate environment

- Provide guidance to Tier 1 support and team members

- Meet and exceed SLA standards: Close tickets in a timely manner, while upholding customer service standards

If you are interested in this position, please send an updated resume to [email protected] 
 - Ability to simplify complex problems and build solutions

 - ITIL certification will strengthen your position for the job

- Background in one or more programming or scripting language

- 1+ years of experience supporting desktop/server operating systems and technologies such as Active Directory, DNS, Exchange and VMware

- Ability to multitask and communicate well with individuals of all backgrounds

- Can work independently with minimal supervision

- Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing

- In this role, the candidate will be able to analyze complex business problems, propose effective solutions and understand and apply business vision and direction

- Solid understanding of Microsoft Windows

 - Candidates who have technical skills to serve as escalation point for handling incidents and service requests related to application, operating system and other service related problems will be preferred

 - Candidates who have a combination of superior customer service skills and technical aptitude will be preferred

Medical insurance

Critical illness insurance
24-Hour group accident insurance
AD&D insurance
Vision insurance
Performance and completion bonuses

description:
Accountemps is supporting our long-time client, a prestigious financial firm located in Boca Raton, in need of a Fund Accountant to join their team! If you are looking to grow your financial career or know someone who is, please call Jessica Gorant at 561-994-8944

REASON FOR ROLE: The ideal candidate will be responsible for the daily, monthly, quarterly and annual accounting recordkeeping and reporting of assigned mutual funds and will analyze data to identify potential issues and perform research to develop appropriate solutions.

FUND ACCOUNT DUTIES:

Control and balance accounts and output post accounting entries and transactions to ledger according to established procedures and regulatory rules.
Perform calculations for an assigned group of funds & accounts which include cash projections, reconciliation of trade activity and corporate actions, reconciliation of holdings and review and analysis of income and expenses.
Analyze fund and account data to identify potential problems and develop appropriate solutions.
Preparation of reports provided to internal and external customers including maintenance of supporting documentation.
Ensure that required records are maintained and stored according to appropriate retention of policy in a timely and accurate manner.
Assist in the development of policies and procedures for work performed.
Assist in identifying opportunities for process improvement and greater efficiencies.
Assumes additional duties as requested or assigned.
Overtime may be required on short notice and may include evening, weekend and holiday hours. 
 FUND ACCOUNTANT QUALIFICATIONS:

One-year investment accounting experience preferred
Bachelors' degree in Accounting/Finance or equivalent required.
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills.
General knowledge of investment and financial services industries preferred.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy with the ability to work independently within established guidelines.
Strong knowledge of MS Word and Excel.
Accounting system knowledge preferred with strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize multiple projects.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Outbound Customer Service Sales Representative Roles! 

A third party marketing and telecommunications company is looking for multiple Outbound Customer Service Sales Assistants to add to their growing and dynamic team. This is a temporary to full time hire opportunity. 

How you will make an impact: 
As an Outbound Customer Service Sales representative you will make telephone-based prospecting and cold calls for lead generation purposed. Your outbound calls will be to small business owners and merchants to perform quality control on their point of sale machines. You will speak directly with business owners or decision makers to gather the information needed. This is a goal oriented call to ensure the point of sale system is working properly.

Interest/Experience in outbound / cold calling preferred!
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent phone and computer skills
Ability to demonstrate innovation and good judgment/problem solving skills when making decisions
Solid organization and follow up skills

Commission is provided on successful point of sale quality assurance tests! Up to $400 - $500 monthly! 

If you are a goal driven individual that thrives in a team oriented company this could be the position for you!

- Comfort and confidence when interacting with internal and external partners and clients/customers

- Active problem-solver who listens for customer cues and actively resolves problems with grace and integrity

- Enthusiastic attitude and an engaging businesslike approach

- Deep understanding of retail

The motivated individual in this role will perform the following functions:
- Provide excellent customer service as a Customer Field Representative.

- 3-5 years in a Customer Service position or experience in the Logistics and Supply Chain, preferably in a regulated manufacturing environment.

- Should possess excellent written and oral communication skills. 
- It is required that the person who will excel in this role will be a self-starter with demonstrated and efficient work methods.
- To be successful in this role the individual must demonstrate the ability to analyze & problem-solve with the ability to handle multiple tasks in a very fast-paced environment.
- Must have the ability to work with a team of individuals who collaborate well together and be part of a multi-disciplined team.

Experience with IT ticketing systems
Windows OS Management
Active Directory Account Administration
Knowledge of desktop and client management through tools such as SCCM, Dell KACE, GFI Lansweeper
IT Asset Management and tracking experience
Apple iOS, Android OS, and general mobile device provisioning experience
Microsoft Office 365 Suite installation and troubleshooting skills

summary: If you are skilled in maintaining the production of accurate and timely payroll for employees, communicate effectively, and deliver strong internal customer service while working in a deadline-driven environment, you may be the candidate a...
description:
If you are skilled in maintaining the production of accurate and timely payroll for employees, communicate effectively, and deliver strong internal customer service while working in a deadline-driven environment, you may be the candidate a client of Robert Half Finance and Accounting is searching for for their new Payroll Administrator role. This full-time employment opportunity is based in the Clearwater, Florida area. Submit your application as soon as possible!

Key responsibilities

- Give support to staff with general questions related to payroll, PTO accruals, wage deductions, fringe benefits and other pay related issues

- Expand systems and protocols to direct the collection, calculation and entering of pay data

- Handle voluntary deductions, as well as wage garnishments, pay levies, and other involuntary court-ordered payments in a timely manner, including reporting to the necessary authorities

- Carry out regular payroll reporting as required and assist with financial audits related to pay records and associated general ledger

- Provide timely processing of payroll in accordance with labor regulations and standard accounting principles

- Look into payroll areas, pay practices related to FLSA, and fringe benefit reporting to determine how those practices apply to advise management

- Join forces Information Technology, Human Resources, and other internal business partners to ensure security protocols for pay systems

- Manage data entered by others in the payroll software to include, but not limited to salary/wage increases, benefit deductions, employee termination dates, and employee leaves of absence under FMLA or other unpaid leave

- Organize quarterly and year-end payroll reports

- Follow current payroll tax requirements and relevant laws associated with the processing of employee wage data, including payroll taxes, employee federal and state income and social security taxes and other required reporting 
 - Demonstrated ability in garnishments, various withholdings, and processing liens

- 3+ years of payroll experience

 - Background in HRIS system and high proficiency with spreadsheets

- Payroll for over 500 employees experience

- Knowledge of multi-state payroll

- Experience working with the General Ledger, Making Journal Entries, and Reconciliation highly preferred

- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel

summary: Accountemps has an immediate opportunity for a skilled, knowledgeable, highly motivated, and success driven team player to join a Contract/Procurement Unit, which will develop and maintain compliance with department wide contracting and...
description:
Accountemps has an immediate opportunity for a skilled, knowledgeable, highly motivated, and success driven team player to join a Contract/Procurement Unit, which will develop and maintain compliance with department wide contracting and procurement processes. This includes a portfolio of government funds with complex funding sources, including federal, state and local funding, in various human service programs and services.

The Contract/Procurement detail oriented is a detail oriented that will play a key role in assuring efficient and effective procurement processes for the department. The desired candidate has expertise in government procurement and contract management. 

Job Duties
•	Creates, maintains and follows department wide procurement policies and the requirements and regulations concerning the procurement process. 
•	Maintains good relationships with vendor. 
•	Creates and/or maintains department wide contracting policies and procedures, requirements and regulations concerning the contract process. 
•	Works with subject matter experts to edit scopes of work, technical specifications, and other solicitation/contract documents for clarity and consistency. 
•	Coordinates program, finance, evaluation and administrative teams to support contract processes. 
•	Other duties as assigned. 
 Experience, Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills
•	Demonstrated understanding and experience with the principles, practices, and terminology typically used. 
•	Knowledge of contract administration and federal, state, and county statutes and regulations pertaining to procurement of contracts. 
•	Experience and knowledge of procurement theory, principles and practices, contract development, and contract negotiations. 
•	Experience facilitating discussions, resolving conflicts, and finding resolutions. 
•	Experience streamlining work processes, improving operations, decreasing turnaround time, meeting deadlines, and working cooperatively to provide quality seamless customer service. 
•	Strong communication, writing, problem-solving, analytical, and investigative research skills. 
•	Demonstrated skill in development and documentation of policies and procedures. 
•	Demonstrated ability in prioritizing workloads, working successfully under pressure with tight timelines and changing priorities. 
•	Any equivalent combination of experience and education, which provides the applicant with the desired skills, knowledge, and ability required to perform the work. 
•	Experience handling multiple solicitations while managing competing priorities. 
•	Expert organizational skills and the ability to adapt to rapidly changing deadlines. 
•	Ability to work collaboratively with program managers to secure integrated work products. 
•	Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office suite.

If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, please email with your resume. Kayedee at [email protected]

Robert Half Technology is looking for a Junior Software Engineer for a 3 month contract-to-hire opportunity in Miami, FL with a leader in the travel software industry. For further information on this opportunity, please email: pavel[dot]raphael[at]rht[dot]com

Medical insurance

AD&D insurance

Experience with XML a plus

For immediate consideration, please email an updated copy of your resume to: pavel[dot]raphael[at]rht[dot]com (please include the title of the position you are applying to)

jobtitle: Commercial Real Estate Loan Servicing Specialist
summary: Accountemps is currently seeking a commercial real estate loan servicing specialist for a Credit Union in Brea, CA ! The commercial real estate loan servicing specialist will be responsible for payment processing, monthly loan billing, file...
description:
Accountemps is currently seeking a commercial real estate loan servicing specialist for a Credit Union in Brea, CA ! The commercial real estate loan servicing specialist will be responsible for payment processing, monthly loan billing, file maintenance, and annual reviews & correspondance. The ideal loan servicing specialist should have experience processing commercial real estate loans! 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

-Responsible for the setting up (boarding) and servicing of all Commercial Real Estate Loans in the core loan system. 
-Process daily loan payments and prepare supporting cash balancing documentation and reports. 
-Assist in the preparation of loan annual review/compliance correspondence to borrowers, and collection of requested financial information.
-Facilitate and distribute monthly loan (billing) statements.
-Assist in the creation of department loan portfolio management files, maintenance and documentation filing and scanning.
-Provide professional and efficient service to credit union staff and Members relating to their commercial real estate loan. 
-Understand and is accountable for executing all job functions in a way that is consistent with all requirements of BSA, OFAC, and The USA Patriot Act/Customer Identification Act (CIP). 
-All other ad-hoc activities and duties as assigned. 
 QUALIFICATIONS-

-Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related-field, or three or more years experience in real estate lending or servicing, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
-The ability to interpret and comply with policies and regulatory requirements and learn and administer accounting principles responsibilities, credit union procedures and regulations.
-Ability to work independently within specific time constraints with a high degree of accuracy.
-Ability to read and interpret legal documentation and finance-related terms and conditions. 
-Analytical skills to include the ability to define problems, collect data, recognize reasonableness, and draw valid conclusions.
-Outstanding interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
-Time management and organizational skills to rapidly adapt and respond to unscheduled events or changes, ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure.
-Strong PC skills with an emphasis on spreadsheet and word processing applications and ability to use job specific computer applications.

summary: •	Build and operate a 24/7 Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC), including outsourced level1 SOC and insourced Level2 SOC function; moving to insourced Level1 in 2018/2019, if successful •	Contract and establish outsource Level1 SOC...
description:
•	Build and operate a 24/7 Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC), including outsourced level1 SOC and insourced Level2 SOC function; moving to insourced Level1 in 2018/2019, if successful
•	Contract and establish outsource Level1 SOC through managed security services partner; establish SLAs, agree and implement end-to-end process; establish Level2 SOC capabilities in house
•	Ensure processes and practices are in place for incident identification, assessment, reporting and escalations, and tracking issues and alerts to closure/mitigation as applicable; develop, design, and define alerts and processes for responding to such alerts
•	Collaborate with Forensics, Security Engineering, Threat and Vulnerability Management team in matters of investigations; work with peers to build adequate incident response and forensics capabilities and processes
•	Facilitate and review security technologies, hardware, and software; work with vendors and procurement to obtain best pricing; develop key metrics and performance goals including real time feedback and more formal reviews
•	Work with broader security engineering and operations team to manage SIEM platforms including design and engineering; take ownership of these engineering and design aspects as team grows
•	Review, analyze, troubleshoot, and drive issue resolution utilizing different data feeds - SIEMs, intelligence feeds, threat detection systems, IDS/IPS, antivirus servers, and vulnerability management scanners 
 •	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
•	7 years of related experience
•	2 years of experience leading a Security Operations Center
•	Knowledge of SIEM technology with experience working with Splunk Enterprise Security
•	Knowledge of corporate cybersecurity threat landscape
•	Knowledge of fundamental SOC performance metrics
•	To have a threat hunter’s mentality
•	Experience in creating process and procedure documentation for SOC operation
•	Experience with ServiceNow Sec Ops integrations with SOC process
•	Strong leadership and communication skills
•	Knowledge of tactics and targets of Nation State actors and APTs
•	Knowledge of Cloud structure and Security monitoring capabilities for AWS, Azure, O365
•	Knowledge of intrusion detection methodologies and techniques for detecting host and network-based intrusions. 
•	Knowledge of industry-standard and organizationally accepted analysis principles and methods.
•	Knowledge of cyber threats and vulnerabilities. 
•	Knowledge of penetration testing principles, tools, and techniques. 
•	Knowledge of incident response and handling methodologies. 
•	Knowledge of network traffic analysis methods. 
•	Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies. 
•	Knowledge of system and application security threats and vulnerabilities 
•	Demonstrated experience with data analysis, documentation, and reporting.
•	Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook), Visio and Access.
•	Strong problem-solving, networking, and team-building skills.
•	Advanced written and verbal communication skills.
•	Ability to work independently and with limited supervision to achieve assigned goals and objectives.
•	Ability to multitask in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

summary: Robert Half Finance is currently partnering with a Manufacturing Plant in Woodland on a Continuous Improvement Manager search. The Company is a global, multi-billion dollar operation, and the facility in Woodland generates approximately $...
description:
Robert Half Finance is currently partnering with a Manufacturing Plant in Woodland on a Continuous Improvement Manager search. The Company is a global, multi-billion dollar operation, and the facility in Woodland generates approximately $100mm in annual revenue. The Continuous Improvement Manager is responsible for driving the development and implementation of continuous improvement projects consistent with and in support of the strategic plan and the business operating plan. The CI Manager will own the Lean maturity assessments and improvement initiatives for the site. This position will also partner with the site Controller and corporate counterparts to validate achieved CI savings and deployment objectives. 

The ideal candidate will have experience with the following: designing new procedures and methods for operational processes; utilizing project charters with deliverables to work with site leaders to identify, modify, and sustain desired changes including reducing waste and improving efficiencies; mentoring employees to realize benefits from all continuous improvement initiatives and act as a change agent for the site/organization; identifying opportunities for continuous improvement via idea generation; KPI goal setting with the site via semi-annual business assessment; reporting and leading site reporting for KPI’s. The CI Manager must also have thorough understanding of cycle time reduction, waste reduction, yield improvement, productivity, and throughout improvement. 
 BS/BA or equivalent experience, Lean Master or Master Six Sigma Black Belt certification or equivalent, 4-8 years of successful leadership in executing continuous improvement/Lean/Six Sigma efforts, prior leadership or management experience, hands-on experience using operational excellence and continuous improvement methods (LEAN, TPM, Six Sigma), and excellent project management skills. If you pride yourself in being a change agent and challenging organizational leaders to drive continuous improvements, this could be the role for you! Please email Georgia at [email protected] for confidential consideration.

summary: 1. Needs someone familiar with vendor sites such as CommerceHub, Overstock.com, Walmart, Amazon, Kohls, Target. Have familiarity adding new products to those customers via different Excel Uploads that the customers provide, load photos as...
description:
1. Needs someone familiar with vendor sites such as CommerceHub, Overstock.com, Walmart, Amazon, Kohls, Target. Have familiarity adding new products to those customers via different Excel Uploads that the customers provide, load photos as customer requires (email, ftp, portal, etc). Follow up that the products are live on site and products discontinued internally are also discontinued on the sites. 
2. ERP and basic server/Remote Desktop Familiarity. Printers are run by a screen in the ERP that just needs to be reopened if it crashes. Occasionally servers need to be restarted. 
3. Logistics familiarity. Updating customer product codes and case pack sizes within system and ensuring proper information is on customer’s carton labels. Routing orders on customer’s portals and following ERP procedures to ensure Bill of Lading is properly filled out and sent out. 
4. Excel is a must. VLookup and SUMIF are probably two most important functions used in Excel at EHP. 
5. ERP experience is in a distribution environment is a must. Apprise is great but not as well known. They must have used something other than QuickBooks, such as Sage, SAP, Infor, etc… EDI system familiarity such as High Jump, RedTails, 123EDI etc is helpful, in addition to WMS experience.

Additional skills
• Customer requirements change all the time. Person must be able to adapt and change to new procedures that accommodate the customer.
• Understanding the difference between a purchase order and a sales order and know the different classes of purchase orders or sales orders.

Please send resume to [email protected]

summary: Chargeback Dispute Specialist  Accountemps is looking for a well-organized Chargeback Dispute Specialist with strong Microsoft Office skills and an attention for detail. If you're a self-starter looking to build your career in finance, this...
description:
Chargeback Dispute Specialist 
Accountemps is looking for a well-organized Chargeback Dispute Specialist with strong Microsoft Office skills and an attention for detail. If you're a self-starter looking to build your career in finance, this may be the job for you.

Your responsibilities in this role
•	Processes and updates new and existing account credit files in a time manner.
•	If over the limit of authority, makes appropriate recommendations to the Credit Manager on increasing/decreasing credit limits.
•	Actively participates in our industry credit group, including exchanging mutual customer credit information and attending meetings and teleconferences.
•	Contacts delinquent and/or over credit limit customer accounts in a timely manner.
•	Follows up with customers on payment schedule promises.
•	Maintains customer accounts updated with status, both in credit files and system.
•	Maintains select customer’s accounts web portals updated.
•	Researches chargebacks/deductions.
•	Works with Customer Service, Sales and Accounting to obtain data and documentation to determine whether or not a customer’s claim is valid.
•	Disputes and follows up on invalid claims with customers in a timely manner, including using their web portals.
•	If claims are valid, follows up on the issuance of credits for chargebacks.
•	Submits chargebacks and related credits to Accounting for adjustment.
•	Maintains chargeback logs updated.
•	Processes credit card payments.
•	Processes checks by fax or email.
•	General office duties: filing, making copies, scanning, faxing, etc. 
 What we’re looking for
•	Bachelor’s degree in related field 
•	Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, specifically Word, Outlook and internet applications
•	Ability to enter data into various electronic systems while maintaining the integrity and accuracy of the data
•	Excellent verbal, written, and social skills

All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States.

summary: Are you looking for a new opportunity as a Quality Assurance Engineer in the Chicago based- area please email your resume to mannah.charles2roberthalf.com.  This is a position in Quality Assurance responsible for developing and executing...
description:
Are you looking for a new opportunity as a Quality Assurance Engineer in the Chicago based- area please email your resume to mannah.charles2roberthalf.com.

This is a position in Quality Assurance responsible for developing and executing performance and automation tests. This position plans and executes effective and efficient performance and automation testing to accomplish on-time and efficient delivery of high-quality software products and/or data. 
 Experience (the US only) and Education 
• 3+ years of QA Test Engineering experience 
• BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required 
• Key Responsibilities 
• Develop and execute automated and performance testing for assigned projects to successfully and consistently enable the delivery of high-quality software products and services on time, on budget, and to specification. 
• Interact with Product Management, Project Management, Engineering, and Operations teams to plan testing for delivery of products and enhancements and to assure products meet product requirements and quality standards. 
• Maintain flexibility to react quickly to changes in priorities or circumstances to meet the needs of the business. 
• Work with QA/Testing staff, project managers, technical leads, and subject matter experts to plan and execute automated and performance tests. 
• Report issues and results, researching and identifying root causes as appropriate, documenting accordingly. 
• Ensure that testing addresses requirements as agreed with other stakeholders. 
• Research available tools and participate in initiatives to implement those that will cost-effectively enhance testing capabilities and product quality. 
• Identify opportunities to apply existing automation or other tools to meet testing needs. 
• Research and identify root causes of performance issues in partnership with architects, developers, and network and system engineers. 
• Maintain awareness of the state of the industry and evaluate emerging trends/developments that may benefit the organization. 
• Conduct project reviews, ensuring review criteria are defined and implement procedures for ensuring quality control of project deliverables. 
• Cooperate in the enhancement of the methodologies employed for test planning and execution, defect tracking, and metric and status reporting. 
• Participate in continuous improvement initiatives and implementation of best practices. 
• Maintain framework for record retention in order to support internal and external IT audits. 
• Work across teams to enhance quality assurance/testing and help to develop/execute performance and automation testing throughout the business as appropriate. 
• Identify areas for improvement and, with leadership, peers, or others, implement initiatives improving overall capability and efficiency. 
• Ensure the results of root cause analyses are addressed. 
• All other job duties as assigned. 
• Technical Skills 
• Strong understanding of QA methodologies. 
• Strong knowledge of process improvement. 
• Strong knowledge of the software development process. 
• Advanced written and verbal communication skills. 
• Strong project management skills. 
• Solid QA testing skills. 
• Attention to detail. 
• Proven ability to develop and execute automated and performance testing. 
• Basic understanding of working within budgets. 
• Understanding of industry trends. 
• Ability to identify and implement continuous improvement practices. 
• Strong research skills (tools/root cause analysis). 
• Good oral and written communication.

description:
Fast paced, specialty construction company is seeking an experienced construction project manager to run the Project Operations department. This individual will oversee a team of project managers to help deliver projects to customers’ satisfaction. This newly created role is also responsible for accurate and timely job status reporting and work with the Finance department to make sure all data is properly entered into the ERP system. The company will also be looking to roll out new project management software throughout the enterprise and this individual will be responsible for this implementation. Must have 10+ years of experience in construction project management with a background that includes managing teams providing project status reports to management. Compensation will be commensurate with experience. Position will have dual reporting structure; reporting to both the Chief Financial Officer and Head of Operations.

Key Responsibilities
Manage team of Project Managers and help them deliver projects on time, on budget, and to customers’ satisfaction
Design and implement process to track and report status of projects in real time
Partner with Finance department to quality check data inputs in ERP system
Send weekly reports to upper management
Must results and task oriented
Must be flexible in accommodating busy, client-oriented working hours
Self-motivated and ability to prioritise amongst competing demands
Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment

For immediate consideration please contact me at [email protected] or call 614-221-9300 
 Skills/ Education
Bachelor’s Degree (MBA preferred)
5+ years of construction or project oversight experience
Proven team-building and management skills
Track record of creating organizational structures and business process management
Strong understanding of work in progress and project accounting
Supervise all project management teams ensuring that they work in cooperation 
Conduct weekly project management meeting
Help design and implement incentive-based compensation system
Help design and deliver monthly PM team performance review
Track life cycle of projects from identification of initial opportunity to payment of invoice (submittal of bids to clients, receipt of purchase order, job number creation, receipt of change order, invoicing, receipt of payment, ensuring costs are tracked to correct jobs)
Track subcontractor bids and performance
Sign off on all Operations team time sheets
Implement time tracking for appropriate salaried employees 
Track operations by project, by client, by geography, by internal PM & CM
Recruit and develop project management and construction management employees as needed
Serve as liaison between Operations and Finance departments
Audit project financials
Audit and improve existing business processes for entire project management department creating uniform processes and meeting reporting demands of the finance department
Support project management teams in daily tasks such as on boarding new vendors, hiring new employees, meeting client demands, establishing new supply chains, producing deliverables to clients, licensing with respective jurisdictions, complete qualification packages required by client 
Perform non-finance related human resources functions
Selection and implementation of business process management/ project management software 
Selection and implementation of CRM software
Create inventory management system and oversee implementation of inventory management software

For immediate consideration please contact me at [email protected] or call 614-221-9300

summary: The AV Technician manages and maintains integrated and non-integrated conference rooms and spaces. This position requires strong analytical, technical, written, and presentation skills and a strong focus on customer service. The role works...
description:
The AV Technician manages and maintains integrated and non-integrated conference rooms and spaces. This position requires strong analytical, technical, written, and presentation skills and a strong focus on customer service. The role works directly with internal/external clients, IT Project Management, Field Services, Real Estate & Facilities, and Account Management teams to ensure successful delivery of our service, which must meet established Service Level Agreements (SLAs). The candidate provides a “white glove” level of service and interfaces daily with agency employees, executives, their clients, and third-party AV partners. Relationship building within the agencies, a sense of urgency while remaining calm, and resourcefulness are keys to success in this role. The position reports to the AV Service Manager with a dotted line to a Field Services Supervisor or Operations Manager.

***FOR IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION, please send your resumes to Brendan Steele or to [email protected] or call (310) 719-7356*

JOB FUNCTIONS
Troubleshooting 
•	Diagnose and troubleshoot equipment failures and make minor adjustments to resume a working state, assess audio and visual issues.
•	Use Fusion monitoring software to proactively monitor all rooms/spaces on the network and ensure the software is connecting to the audio-visual equipment in the rooms as programmed.
•	After installation of new equipment, test and debug systems for final quality assurance and acceptance.

Room Management 
o	Inspect conference rooms and spaces for the following:
	Wiring, laptop, audio, and videoconference connections are working
	Cable management – ensure wiring on and under tables are organized
	Look for projection and audio issues
	Ensure control panels correctly switch inputs
	Check for broken clips or pins on connection and Ethernet cables
•	Assist with operating equipment during meetings and events
•	Log tickets into Service Now to track service requests and issues
•	Track inventory of supplies needed for AV equipment and request replacements before out of stock.
•	Report unusual noises, room lighting issues, broken door hinges, broken table legs/table issues, furniture issues, food left over from previous meetings to the local Office Manager.

Communication
•	Ability to speak effectively before groups of employees.
•	Strong verbal and written communications.
•	Strong desire to learn.
•	Ability to run usage reports and provide analysis. 
•	Respond to email requests for future video conferencing events and coordinate requirements before date of events.

Training
•	Assist with writing and distributing training documentation.
•	Conduct onsite training on the operation and capabilities of installed equipment.
•	Learn the local digital signage system and assist with posting and maintaining content.

Vendor Management
•	Work with preferred AV partners to report issues and ensure repairs and work are completed to specification. 
•	Coordinate with AV partners to book rooms and times available to repair equipment. 

Work Schedule
•	Maintain a flexible schedule and be available to work non-standard business hours such as weekends and holidays upon request or as needed.
•	Must be available via cell phone for issue resolution and assistance.

Travel
•	This position may involve site visits to other locations to assist with meetings and events. 
 ***FOR IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION, please send your resumes to Brendan Steele or to [email protected] or call (310) 719-7356*
