summary: Robert Half Technology is in URGENT need of a NOC Analyst for a 3 month project in West LA for a prestigious technology company. They are hiring URGENTLY and interviewing immediately.    Leverage industry standard tools, experience and...
description:
Robert Half Technology is in URGENT need of a NOC Analyst for a 3 month project in West LA for a prestigious technology company. They are hiring URGENTLY and interviewing immediately. 


Leverage industry standard tools, experience and proactive testing to monitor the availability and performance of server infrastructure and networks.
Respond to alerts, inbound email/voice calls and fault detection with event classification, prioritization, triage, communication, diagnostics, documentation and escalation as needed.
Diagnose, troubleshoot and repair network and systems quality and outage issues remotely; Escalate to Production Engineering as necessary.
Create, update and route trouble tickets as needed using trouble ticketing system in response to issues detected. Track ticket status to resolution and close out documentation.
Adhere to response and resolution timelines to ensure quarterly network performance and uptime goals/objectives.
Create and update Shift Reports and Turnovers. Participate in the turnover process with outgoing and incoming shift teams.
Maintain network performance standards throughout venue lifecycle through coordination with Systems Engineering and Production Field Engineering Teams for alert/event resolution, threshold definitions, trend analysis and proactive maintenance.
Coordinate onsite break/fix dispatches with third party vendors. Monitors dispatches to ensure they’re completed within SLA parameters and assist w/ statement of work to be performed on site.


****FOR IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION FOR THIS NOC ANALYST POSITION, PLEASE EMAIL YOUR RESUME DIRECTLY TO [email protected] ***** 
 List of must haves:

	1. At least 1+ years in a NOC environment or Tier 3 Support (someone who is, or has been, a network admin may also work, if they’re interested in working in a NOC environment).
	2. Strong understanding of RADIUS, DNS, firewall, packet captures, VM, IPSec, TCP/IP, VLAN, WLAN, VPN and Wi-Fi protocols and technologies
	3. Strong understanding of several industry standard monitoring tools (PagerDuty, Splunk, Orion, Cisco NCS/WCS, Aruba Airwave etc.)
	4. Experience using ticketing systems such as JIRA or ServiceNow, along with experience escalating technical issues.

Big plus:

	1. CCNA (other certs like CompTia aren’t really attention-getters).
	2. Previous experience in wireless networking specifically.

****FOR IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION FOR THIS NOC ANALYST POSITION, PLEASE EMAIL YOUR RESUME DIRECTLY TO [email protected] *****

My client is a well-established Engineering Firm located in downtown Washington, D.C. with a need for a Billing & Accounts Payable Specialist. The Billing & Accounts Payable Specialist will report directly to the Controller and will be tasked with preparing client invoices, reconciling accounts, processing vendor invoices, and assisting with monthly AP and AR reporting. BS/BA in Accounting, Finance, Business is required

summary: The Creative Group is looking for an Sales Planner to join our client on a 3 to 6 month contract to full-time opportunity in the phoenix area.  Account Coordinator must be self-directed and be able to complete projects on deadlines with...
description:
The Creative Group is looking for an Sales Planner to join our client on a 3 to 6 month contract to full-time opportunity in the phoenix area.

Account Coordinator must be self-directed and be able to complete projects on deadlines with minimal coaching. This is a fast-paced environment where an ideal candidate can handle constructive criticism and be able to work with a team. The culture is very much the "work hard, play hard" mentality commonly found in agency settings. 


***MUST HAVE EXCELLENT PIVOT TABLE AND V-LOOK UP SKILLS***


POSITION SUMMARY:

This position will report to the Campaign Planning Manager, North America and play a critical role in supporting the initiatives of the Loyalty and Personalization platforms through effective management and planning of campaigns and promotions. These campaigns will be executed through the portfolio of customer marketing solutions. 

The Campaign Planner will be a key contact for the Sales team and will need to work efficiently and effectively with multiple functions of the Loyalty and Personalization Marketing team to include sales management, content operations, ad schedulers as well as CPG clients and partners. 
The individual needs to be a high-achiever with superior communication skills who is a reliable self-starter, results driven and effective at collaborating across teams to drive desired results. Must possess capacity to manage workload peaks, strong multitasking skills and ability to meet tight deadlines. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 

	Serve as the planning and campaign management lead for all loyalty and personalization platforms 
	Responsible for the complete lifecycle of all campaigns, including pre-sales strategy, reserving/booking inventory, responding to RFP’s, creating/updating insertion orders, campaign management, reporting, and post campaign analysis 
	Lead in the creation of proposals for incoming RFPs by creating media plans to meet advertiser and category objectives 
	Respond to sales requests about inventory, ad products, creative specifications, and research 
	Ensure campaign plans include accurate pricing and utilize approved products and available inventory while adhering to defined business processes to ensure optimal program performance 
	Effectively communicate program details to internal operation and content management teams 
	Recommend tactical changes to maximize campaign performance 
	Act as a key client contact, developing and maintaining strong relationships while offering innovative solutions to our clients’ business needs 


****PLEASE SEND RESUME TO [email protected] GROUP.COM**** 
 REQUIREMENTS: 

	Bachelor’s degree in Business/Marketing, Advertising, or related field with retail 
	3+ years’ experience in agency or media planning responsibility 
	Understanding of CPG companies, shopper marketing, and digital marketing go to market strategies 
	Experience in retail sales and marketing a plus 
	Strong communication skills with diligent work ethic, highly organized individual 
	Ability to multi-task and function well under pressure and tight delivery timeframes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment 
	Must be self-motivated, driven and able to work independently as well as part of a team 
	Ability to think outside-the-box and demonstrate creative problem solving 
	Proficiency in Microsoft software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) 
 Excellent Excel skills (Pivot tables, V-lookup)


****PLEASE SEND RESUME TO [email protected] GROUP.COM****

CMS Lead
Location: Encino, CA 
Target Salary: $120,000-$135,000/year
Benefits: M/D/V + Discounted Travel + 401k + Perks 

The Production Operations Manager shall be responsible for all Production environment operations activities and user support services.
The Production Operations Manager shall manage and oversee the operations of all system components in all environments and be the primary CMS point of contact for all production environment issues and activities; remain knowledgeable of industry best practices and tools; and ensure system uptime and performance meets or exceeds established Service Level Objectives and applicable CMS standards.
The Production Operations Manager shall work in close collaboration with team leads, architects, product managers, contractors and other CMS operation centers to ensure availability and reliability of the solution.
The primary responsibilities of the Production Operations Manager include, but are not limited to, the following tasks:

a) Deployment and configuration services in one or more host data centers.
b) Maintenance of the system architecture and environments. c) Installation and management of open source monitoring, or other, tools. d) Installation and management of Configuration Management tools.

Ideally have a technical background.
Need to know how to define requirements with the developers.

One of our top clients with multi-state presence is looking for a Workers Compensation Litigation paralegal with 4 plus years' experience in workers compensation defense or similar litigation practice to join their busy office in downtown Denver. - Assemble documents that require knowledge in determining proper classification of accounting codes and expenditure codes

- Companywide accounting: help with G/L account reconciliation and month-end closing, other ad hoc projects

- Aid Accounts Payable: vendor invoices and disbursement filing, A/P invoice matching & filing

- Work with Accounts Receivable: apply cash receipt, help with collection of past due balance, and process daily invoices/credit 
 - Spreadsheet and ERP system experience preferred

- Accounts receivable experience

- Knowledge of Microsoft Excel

- Microsoft Word experience desired

- Customer service experience highly desired

- Deep understanding of Microsoft Outlook

- Proven knowledge of accounts payable

- Outstanding data entry skills

- Ability to multitask effectively

- AA or BS/BA in Accounting or related field preferred

summary: A Minneapolis online university is looking for a Chat Support Representative to start immediately!   Chat Support Representatives are primarily responsible for handling incoming chats from the university Visitor Center. This individual...
description:
A Minneapolis online university is looking for a Chat Support Representative to start immediately! 

Chat Support Representatives are primarily responsible for handling incoming chats from the university Visitor Center. This individual provides prospective learners with information about and determines the level of interest with the goal of connecting the prospect with the most appropriate resource. 
Chat Support Representatives will also make outbound calls to prospective learners who have inquired with the university and staff inbound phone queues in the evening, answering general questions and providing tier 1 level support to both prospective and current learners.

Job Functions:
80% Answer and communicate via chat 
-Engage in incoming chats from both prospective and current learners. Answer questions and provide general support. 
-Determine the needs of the prospect or learner to provide an efficient transfer to the appropriate individual or team
-Manage multiple chats at once
-Utilize tools, systems and software applications to manage learner data and answer questions.
-Operate within a team reinforcing a high quality, timely prospect/learner experience. This entails supporting colleagues, other departments, taking an active part in team discussions, 1:1 coaching sessions, and providing constructive feedback to management. 

15% Answer and communicate via phone 
-Answer tier 1 level questions to support our Enrollment Services and Academic Advising departments.
-Determine the needs of the caller and provide an appropriate solution which aligns with the teams business processes and guidelines. 
-Utilize tools, systems and software applications to manage learner data and answer questions.

5% Outbound call campaigns to leads, opportunity and applications
-Conduct outbound calling to prospects who have requested information about the university
-Support other call campaign efforts according to the needs of the organization
-Determine the needs of the prospect to provide an efficient transfer to the appropriate individual or team

This is a long-term, open-ended temporary position that could go permanent for the right candidate. This is NOT a remote position, it sits out of the Minneapolis office.

To be considered for this Chat Support Representative position send resumes to [email protected] with "Chat Rep" in the subject line! **When you email to apply please include your typing score if you know it, thanks** 
 Qualifications:
-1-2 years of experience working in a professional setting leveraging strong written and verbal communication skills in addition to solid customer service skills
-Associate degree preferred
-Type at least 50 WPM, prefer 60-70 WPM
-Experience using MS Office (Word, Excel, One Note, SharePoint, Outlook) 
-Strong written and verbal communication skills
-Experience using the internet and internet based collaborative, chat instant messaging and related communication tools
-Ease with learning new technology 
-Superior organization, prioritization, and self-motivation skills 
-Superior customer service skills 
-Ability to multitask and shift priorities quickly 
-Must be self-directed in accomplishing workflow 
-Must be able to spend significant time working at a computer

To be considered for this Chat Support Representative position send resumes to [email protected] with "Chat Rep" in the subject line! **When you email to apply please include your typing score if you know it, thanks**

Job Description:

description:
Candidates seeking a challenging position with an industry leader and a strong career growth opportunity, might be interested in this Lead Payroll Administration role. Robert Half Finance and Accounting has a client with a Lead Payroll Administrator opening that is looking to staff now. To succeed in this role, you should have the ability to communicate effectively and deliver strong internal customer service while working in a deadline-driven environment. The accurate and timely production of payroll for employees will be ensured by the Payroll Administrator in this position. This full-time employment opportunity is based in the Englewood, Colorado area. If you are interested in this position, please contact Louis Waller at [email protected] or 303-694-9111. 

How you will make an impact

- Oversee regular payroll reporting as required and assist with financial audits related to pay records and associated general ledger

- Aim for timely processing of payroll in accordance with labor regulations and standard accounting principles

- Assess data entered by others in the payroll software to include, but not limited to salary/wage increases, benefit deductions, employee termination dates, and employee leaves of absence under FMLA or other unpaid leave

- Examine payroll areas, fringe benefit reporting, and pay practices related to FLSA to determine how those practices apply to advise management

- Cooperate with Human Resources, Information Technology, and other internal business partners to ensure security protocols for pay systems

- Administer quarterly and year-end payroll reports

- Develop systems and protocols to direct the collection, calculation and entering of pay data

- Supervise voluntary deductions, as well as wage garnishments, pay levies, and other involuntary court-ordered payments in a timely manner, including reporting to the necessary authorities

- Abide with current payroll tax requirements and relevant laws associated with the processing of employee wage data, including payroll taxes, employee federal and state income and social security taxes and other required reporting

- Facilitate staff with general questions related to payroll, other pay related issues, wage deductions, PTO accruals, and fringe benefits 
 5+ years of payroll experience 
Kronos software experience 
Advance Excel skills

This position will be a great fit for someone looking to expand their skills in a well-known firm. This is a full-time position with a competitive salary. For IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION, please send resume in WORD format to [email protected]

Robert Half Strategic Accounts is seeking an Office Services Associate for a temp-to-perm role with a technology company in San Francisco! 
The Office Services Associate will provide support in one or all of the following areas: operates duplicating equipment, performs associated copying tasks, scanning equipment, operate low to mid volume mail processing equipment. Ships and receives product and supplies, sorts, distributes and handles incoming and outgoing mail/faxes, as well as applies necessary postage. Provides copier maintenance and first call response for customer site equipment. May also perform one of the following at entry level: bindery, Quality Control and final check, housekeeping, file services, call center representative, etc. This position reports directly to the Site Manager, Site Supervisor or Assistant Site Manager, depending on site personnel configuration.

Operate MS Office and Email systems Perform basic scanning responsibilities
Ensures convenience copiers are working properly, checking for quality via daily inspections.

Performs furniture/conference room set up Performs Fulfillment functions
Calculates charges for jobs performed and maintains logs.
Responds to and coordinates all service calls required by customer.
May perform filing duties in conjunction with specific customer requests.
Delivers completed jobs to pre-determined customer locations within and outside of the site.
Maintains daily meter and service logs.
Answers customer questions regarding status or feasibility of job requests.
Ensures upkeep of convenience copier areas by keeping neat and well stocked.
Performs duties related to the shipping and/or receiving of materials in a mailroom type environment
Uses shrink-wrap machine, paper cutter, hole driller, bindery equipment, jogger, tape machine, stackers, electric stapler and scales in completion of various jobs contracted.
Uses all copier equipment, calculator, fax machine, postage meter and some PC.
Performs filing duties, which may include 'purging' and archiving old documents.

 For immediate consideration, apply directly to Natasha.Sanoy [AT] Roberthalf [DOT] com  
 
Requires high school diploma, GED, or equivalent work experience

Professional communication and image

summary: Robert Half Healthcare Practice is currently hiring for an Optician with a client located in Westfield, IN! Opticians strive to always provide our customers with an extraordinary shopping and ownership experience. Your role as an Optician...
description:
Robert Half Healthcare Practice is currently hiring for an Optician with a client located in Westfield, IN! Opticians strive to always provide our customers with an extraordinary shopping and ownership experience. Your role as an Optician will be to serve each and every shopper with expertise, friendliness, and honesty. 

What you'll do:
Ensure flawless accuracy in taking and recording measurements, adjusting and fitting eyewear and execution of all details as needed
Verify that finished eyewear meets optical standards and customer requirements/requests
Demonstrate exceptional product knowledge and accurately describe features and benefits of various lenses and our frames
Work with other team members to ensure all customers receive exceptional service throughout their shopping and purchasing experience
Comfortably explain eyewear prescription terminology to customers
Provide style consulting and help customers choose the best glasses for their personal style, face type, and lifestyle
Innovate and share best practices for sales and customer service so they can be implemented throughout the organization
Act as a representative for our brand to help educate and excite others about our mission and values 
 Passionate about fashion, eyewear and retail
Able to project a professional, fashion-forward image
Excited by a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
Great at communicating clearly and effectively- in person, on the phone, and online
Dedicated to making people happy– you exceed customer expectations with a great attitude while being a fantastic and fun team player
Self-starter with energy to spare
Excellent detail orientation and time management skills
Cool under pressure and capable of juggling a diverse set of responsibilities (including completing multiple assignments and handling a ton of customers competing for your attention)
Have the flexibility to work days, weekends and some evenings for store extended hours and/or events
Extra Credit:
LDO in states requiring a license to dispense or ABO in non-licensed states
Other details:
This is a full-time, hourly position.

summary: Robert Half Healthcare is currently hiring for an OPTICIAN TECHNICIAN with a client located in Westfield, IN!  Technicians are responsible for all patient’s preliminary testing, assisting the doctors with any exam needs, and any contact...
description:
Robert Half Healthcare is currently hiring for an OPTICIAN TECHNICIAN with a client located in Westfield, IN!

Technicians are responsible for all patient’s preliminary testing, assisting the doctors with any exam needs, and any contact lens related issues. They ensure the practice's quality standards are met, while completing specific, essential responsibilities that pertain to conducting preliminary testing and gathering medical information and the overall patient experience. Technicians report directly to the General Manager at their location and work in a team environment.

·This position primarily maintains a full-time status, however, part-time and seasonal positions are available depending on business needs.

·Locations maintain working hours of 8a-7p/8p Monday through

Friday and varying hours on Saturdays; the individual must be able to work a flexible schedule to include evenings and weekends as job duties and projects demand.

·This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.

Position Responsibilities

·Performs all preliminary and any doctor requested testing on patients.

·Accurately document patient's medical history and testing results.

·Prepare and clean exam rooms for doctor to perform exams on patients.

·Receive and verify contact lens orders for patients.

·Order and keep inventory of contact lens stock trial lenses, contact lens rebates, contact lens solutions, vitamin supplements, and over the counter and pharmaceutical eye drops.

·Instruct new contact lens wearers on how to insert and remove contact lenses.

·Compliance with company policies and procedures, government regulations and HIPAA guidelines

·Performs all other duties as assigned by management. 
 Basic Requirements

·High School Diploma or GED required

·Certification Required in one of the following fields:

Medical Assisting, Certified Nurse Assistant, Home Health Aid or Medical Technician.

·Minimum of one (1) year experience in a customer service role

·Must complete testing within first year of employment to demonstrate competency in Technician role.

Additional Skills/Preferences

·Optical experience preferred

·Experience with Electronic Medical Records (EMR) preferred

·Strong computer skills and ability to have high accuracy when entering in patient information

·Exceptional interpersonal skills to enhance the patient experience

·Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing

·Ability to work in a fast paced environment and think quickly to ensure expedient service to patients

Ossip Optometry + Ophthalmology is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

As the Facilities Assistant, you will help with many office duties and provide administrative support. This is a highly interactive and vital role and you must exhibit a passion for excellence, can-do attitude and be a pro-active problem solver. You will play a central role in keeping our office operations and activities organized, on-track and moving forward.

Facilities Assistant Responsibilities: 
	- Planning, scheduling and preparing events and meetings including lunches, dinners, parties and speakers.
	- Ensuring meeting rooms are clean and ready with food and materials.
	- Conducting facilities and general office onboarding meetings.
	- Keeping our conference rooms and kitchen clean and orderly including occasionally cleaning dishes.
	- Serving as back-up for our Receptionist.
	- Minor maintenance (including toner replacement, freeing paper jams) for office machinery and coordinating repairs.
	- Managing our travel vendor and facilitating travel arrangements for Directors and Executives.
	- General and confidential filing.

- Minimum high school diploma or GED required
- Must be able to lift and carry items up to 20 lbs. in weight

- Ability to interact professionally with residents and staff
- Ability to communicate effectively in English, both verbally and in written form

Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.

Our client, a growing real estate finance company, is seeking a Closing Coordinator for a full time opportunity. description:
Publicly traded Pharma company located in Bridgewater is looking for a Director of Trade Operations. The Director of Trade Operations will work cross-functionally to ensure the distribution model(s) best support access to Brand Rx Portfolio. The Director will ensure efficient and compliant distribution of current and potential future medicines. This role will collaborate closely with members of Managed Markets, Accounting, Legal, Finance, Global Information Systems, Regulatory, Quality, and Pharmaceutical Operations.
 
Responsibilities

Leverage available data to identify trends and opportunities to improve distribution efficiencies, address risks, and manage budget.
Data Analytics Expert utilizing 852 and 867 enriched channel data
Oversee and execute all Trade notifications and order reviews.
Manage DSA Agreements and relationships working collaboratively with the Director of National Accounts.
Serve as a subject matter expert as a member of New Product Launch teams, and Acquisitions/Divestitures.
Oversee Trade policies and procedures, such as: orders, damages/shortages and order monitoring/inventory management.
Develop and continually evaluate the Trade Distribution model. Identify any necessary changes or adjustments to the model based upon new products, LOE risk mitigation, and/or regulatory and legislative changes. 
 The ideal candidate will have 8+ years experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry. Bachelors degree required. 4+ years of experience within Channel, Trade & Distribution; biotech/pharma experience preferred.

description:
PAYROLL SUPERVISOR! New and exciting opportunity! Be part of a growing and dynamic team! Our client is expanding and requires a full-time, permanent Payroll Supervisor to join the Accounting department! The general duties and responsibilities of the Payroll Supervisor will include, but not limited to: managing the payroll processing and reporting of bi-weekly and semi-monthly, multi-state payroll, for over 1,000 EEs. Other specific duties include: federal/state/local payroll taxes; year-end tax filings; preparation of W2s; direct reviews of pay rates; review and approve payroll deductions; maintain compliance with company policies and governmental regulations; develop and implement payroll process improvements; assist in annual budgeting process; supervise and develop direct reporting staff. Qualifications for the Payroll Supervisor role include: minimum of 7 years of progressive payroll experience; large volume of employee payroll processing; excellent interpersonal skills, including managing direct reports; critical thinking skills; experience with multiple locations; Bachelor's degree is preferred and/or Certified Payroll Professional designation. Our client is a growing business enterprise and offers excellent employee benefits. Interested individuals are encouraged to contact Robert Half International by emailing their resume to Joe Betro at [email protected], or call 330-252-0263. 
 Payroll - Over 500 Employees, Payroll - Multi-State, Payroll, Payroll Management, General Ledger, Compensation Analysis

- File, maintain, and distribute accounting documents, records and reports.
- Validate payments with invoices and maintain administration agreements.
- Process and reconcile monthly corporate credit cards.

description:
Do you enjoy a challenge and can keep up in a fast-paced environment? Do you dream of joining a highly regarded company? If so, Salaried Professional Service is looking for you. As a Senior Accountant, you will prepare and consolidate financial statements, analyze and reconcile accounts, analyze cash flow, produce budgets and forecasting, prepare audits, and handle internal control maintenance and regulatory reporting. Superior analytical skills are crucial to this position. This full-time role offers solid compensation and benefits along with possibility growth.

 How you will make an impact:
 - Coordinate Ad-hoc projects as necessary
 - Prepare Balance Sheet account reconciliations
 - Commitment to continuously improve the automation of the accounting and reporting process
 - Engage in various department-wide initiatives
 - Perform monthly accounting close procedures and deliverables such as journal entries, reconciliations, reports in compliance with GAAP
 - Prepare monthly consolidated P&L and Balance Sheet flux analysis for management reporting
 - Provide analysis on financial results (trends, performance metrics, benchmarks)
 - Successfully collaborate with business partners to ensure compliance with corporate accounting policies, procedures, controls and provide support on special requests when necessary

If you are interested and would like to be considered for immediate hire, contact us at 561-366-8105 or email [email protected] 
 - Earlier experience in public accounting is highly valued
 - Comfortable working in a changing and dynamic environment
 - Deep understanding of internal controls and SOX compliance
 - Strong analytical, communication, and leadership skills
 - 3-5 years of overall general accounting experience, ideally with Big 4 experience
 - BA/BS in Accounting
 - Account analysis experience preferred
 - Proficiency in general ledger
 - Demonstrated knowledge of payroll
 - Budget forecasting experience
 - Solid understanding of month end closings
 - Adeptness in accounts receivable
 - Experience with accounts payable
 - Experience with ERP systems
 - Self-starter, ability to identify issues and resolve problems
 - Great attention to detail
 - Exceptional time management skills preferred
 - Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
 - Dedication and requisite skills to meet critical business deadlines

description:
Are you an IT Administrator In the Houston Area? If so I have a great position!! The GGRE Application Analyst position is responsible for the provision and support of application solutions. This role is responsible for supporting the development and implementation of solutions, the management of infrastructure for the company, and working directly with users to resolve their issues in working with the application and data.

Job duties include working with the Services team to ensure constant standards and implementation of the software. The job also includes ensuring the quality of the application and accuracy of data and assisting in the defining and implementing of best practices. 

Responsibilities may include: 
• Configure and manage applications for efficient use by supported users 
• Work with business analysts and business areas to support their application 
• Supporting, promoting and documenting all application management processes and procedures 
• Identify areas where data can enhance current procedures to improve efficiencies 
• Assist in the prioritization of project work and enhancements 
• Provide support and consult on projects 
• Includes prioritizing tasks, communicating progress, and ensuring requirements are met 
• Responsible for some development/customization of solutions 
• Ensure availability of applications 
• Partnering with other groups as needed (ex: Business Analysts) to test new tools/applications 
• Communicating issues/downtime regarding applications to Business Analysts and customers 
• Partnering with vendors for escalated support. 
• Create and maintain application knowledge center articles 
 Preferred requirements: 
• Bachelor's Degree or 5+ years equivalent work experience working with GGRE applications 

Other requirements: 
• Strong communication skills and the ability to liaise with the following other support groups: 
o Customers, Business Analysts, Data Analysts and technical assistants (Geotechs) within business units 
• Minimum two years direct experience working with or supporting applications 
• Strong understanding of information systems and data 
• Strong understanding of data conversion and translations 
• Strong understanding of UNIX and Windows Environment 
• Strong understanding of application deployment in UNIX and Windows Environment 
• Strong understanding of SQL (SQL Server and Oracle) 
• Knowledge of GGRE Workflows and Processes 
• Computer skills in: 
• suite of GGRE applications (Petrel, DSG, Petra, etc.) 
• customization and administration 
• Ability to maintain the integrity of application 
• Problem solving skills with the ability to solve application and relevant data related problems for the customers 
• Works well under times of intense pressure and adheres to tight deadlines 
• Must be able to prioritize requests and multi-task 
• Ability to learn new applications and techniques quickly

description:
Robert Half Finance is looking to full-time an Accounting Clerk for an influential organization. In this role, you will be responsible for matching invoices to purchase orders and/or vouchers, data entry and assisting in the process of Accounts Payable (A/P) and Accounts Receivable (A/R). You will work with a dynamic team in a great work space/office and have excellent benefits and great career advancement opportunity. This position is a full-time role and is located in the New York, New York area.

How you will make an impact

- Post financial information to journals and ledgers

- Process daily invoices/credit, apply cash receipts, and help with collection of past due balances to support Accounts Receivable

- Assist with general accounting tasks, including G/L account reconciliation and month-end closing, and other ad hoc projects

- Support accounts payable by filing vendor invoice and disbursements and by matching & filing A/P invoices

- Utilize a number of sources to create statements and reports

- Carry out other related duties and work on special projects as assigned

- Reconcile discrepancies by checking all possible sources of disagreement, reconstructing probable actions, and recognizing the effect on other accounts; prepare correction documents as required

- Classify documents with the proper expenditure codes and accounting codes 
 - AA or BS/BA in Accounting or related field preferred

- Prior knowledge in Spreadsheet and ERP system

- Ability to multitask and meet deadlines

- Ability to enter data into various electronic systems while maintaining the integrity and accuracy of the data

summary: Robert Half Technology's client in Tempe, Arizona is looking for a Voice, Conferencing, and Collaboration Analyst to start immediately! This position is responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting enterprise-wide voice,...
description:
Robert Half Technology's client in Tempe, Arizona is looking for a Voice, Conferencing, and Collaboration Analyst to start immediately! This position is responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting enterprise-wide voice, conferencing and collaboration platforms to provide consistent, reliable and secure communications services to the organization's stakeholders and customers. 

Voice, Conferencing and Collaboration service offerings and products include: 
•	Corporate Phone System (Atos Unify, Ribbon SBC, AVST, Empirix)
•	Corporate Voice Recorders (ASC)
•	Dispatch Phone System (Atos Unify, Ribbon SBC, Empirix)
•	Dispatch Voice Recorders (NICE)
•	Enhanced 911 Services (Enable e911)
•	Voice & Video Conferencing (Skype for Business, Polycom Video, Atos Unify, Ribbon SBC, Unify2, WebEx)

The successful candidate will possess the following strengths:
•	Understanding of the OSI model and general networking concepts as they relate to application architecture.
•	A strong background in client support and demonstrated ability to work with clients of varied technical skill levels.
•	Expert knowledge in many areas of the role’s technology focus including service design, monitoring, alerting, management, integration & migration, backup & disaster recovery, in a large organization with multiple data centers.
•	Expert knowledge and application of Microsoft and/or industry best practices and security principles for enterprise telephony and integrated communication and collaboration solutions.
•	Detail oriented with strong analytical, problem solving and technical troubleshooting skills.
•	Well organized with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously.
•	Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively in a team as well as independently when necessary.
•	Excellent oral and written communication skills, including understanding of good documentation practices.

If you're interested in the role, or would like to learn more, please give a call to 602-224-2486 and/ or email [email protected]

description:
Presentation Specialist is responsible for assisting in the design and development of high-impact, visually-engaging medical communications content and new business presentations.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities: 
• Collaborate with Senior Presentation Manager and internal clients in order to understand specific brand concepts, standards and educational objectives in order to interpret them visually.
• Shift gears and adapt to different brands/guidelines in order to work on multiple projects to meet deadlines.
• Format complex medical slides and incorporate medical/scientific and editorial changes, ensure quality control and accuracy; check own work.
• Transform complex content into clear and understandable messages.
• Assist in creating PowerPoint templates collaborating as needed with the Creative team.
• Create/redraw medical data charts, graphs and figures.
• Participate in brainstorming sessions and present PPT design solutions and recommendations.
• Troubleshoot files and prepare both internal and client-supplied materials for production and presentation.
• Organize and maintain project and art files on graphics server.
• Meet established deadlines or provide reasonable notice to Senior Presentation Manager of delays or special circumstances requiring deadline extension.
• Create presentations that incorporate informational graphics, charts, conceptual graphics, diagrams and tables utilizing PowerPoint, Photoshop, and Illustrator to presentations occasionally involve animation and multimedia.

Qualifications: 
• Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 3 years’ experience as a Presentation Specialist in the pharmaceutical, medical communications, and/or advertising industry.
• Excellent level of knowledge in PowerPoint including use of master templates, color themes, animations, transitions, hyperlinking
• Excellent knowledge and experience in the use of Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and Adobe Acrobat
• Strong organization and project management capabilities
• Ability to work both independently and in a team structure
• Keen attention to detail
• Open to receive direction/feedback
• Good organizational and interpersonal skills
• Knowledge of other Adobe Creative Suite programs including Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Premiere a plus
• Knowledge of Prezi and Keynote a plus
• Strong presentation design portfolio 
 Adobe Photoshop

summary: My client, located in Bridgewater, has an opportunity for a Business Manager.   Responsibilities Maintains a current, rolling budget-to-actual reporting system in MIP. Exercises financial control over all expenditures, ensuring that agency...
description:
My client, located in Bridgewater, has an opportunity for a Business Manager. 

Responsibilities
Maintains a current, rolling budget-to-actual reporting system in MIP.
Exercises financial control over all expenditures, ensuring that agency funds are being used in a proper and efficient manner.  
Develops, implements and monitors agency budgets and financial performance of the agency, as related to actual revenue and expenditures. 
Assists with preparation and processing of agency payroll and follows all required procedures for payroll administration including filing of all required federal and state reports. 
Maintains up-to-date knowledge and complies with all legal requirements and governmental regulations in regard to all financial responsibilities
Monitors cash flow, including maintenance of all agency bank accounts. 
Responsible for fiscal soundness, focused on reducing expense and maximizing revenues. 
Prepares financial reports as assigned, including but not limited to reports for the Board of Trustees, Finance Committee, and Monthly Finance Department meetings. Maintains accurate and complete financial records. 
Develop Finance Departments SOP Manual. 
Cross-train all Finance personnel on department SOPs to ensure effective succession planning. 
Regularly keeps President/CEO and COO informed of the business financial status and provides advice on financial matters. 
Establishes and issues salary increases and employee incentive plan bonuses in concert with President/CEO and other department heads following set annual guidelines.
Manages the day-to-day activities of the Finance Department staff. 
Manages the cash flow of revenue and expenses, communicating trends and areas of concern to agency Executive Management Team. 
Reviews and approves the bi-weekly payroll register prior to official. 
 The ideal candidate will have 7+ years of accounting experience. BA Degree in Finance or related required.

description:
Robert Half is seeking a Revenue Cycle Specialist for a fast growing company in the Portland area. This is a 4-5 month role with a great possibility of extension. This role is responsible for understanding and optimizing the revenue cycle and maintaining a comprehensive understanding of the areas that can hinder optimal revenue capture. This position requires an in-depth understanding of coding and compliance rules and regulations. 

Responsibilities:
•	Ensure services provided are accurately captured in the medical record and billed
 appropriately by reviewing charts and individual charting tools/preference lists
•	Research supplies and medications dispensed and review billing
•	Provide feedback based on identified coding and denial trends
•	Maintain a current knowledge of regulations and legislation regarding billing

OfficeTeam is on the lookout for a dynamic, self-motivated and organized Mailroom Assistant to place with a client. This thriving company's Mailroom Assistant role's main duties include receiving and sorting mail and packages in a centralized room before distributing the items to appropriate departments and individuals. This short-term temporary employment opportunity is based in the San Antonio, Texas area.

How you will make an impact

- Record, group, and/or distribute mail and packages

- Direct clerical tasks like word processing, filing, scanning, archiving, and faxing

- Recoup data within allotted time frames

- Comfortable using mail processing equipment

- Maintain optimal machine performance by troubleshooting simple problems (clearing jams, refilling toner, replacing machine oil, etc.)

- 2+ years of prior experience working in a high-volume mailroom setting

- Strong familiarity with switchboard phones from 1-10 lines

- Copying experience preferred

- Office supply and equipment ordering experience required

- Comprehensive knowledge of facilitation

 - The person in this position should be flexible and focused

 - Well trained in mail processing at organizational level

 - Complete general clerical operations tasks that are routine and/or repetitive in nature

- Exceptional time management skills preferred

- Competent in handling office equipment

description:
Law Firm Facilities/Office Services Supervisor 

Our client, a leading international law firm is seeking a 5 plus years facilities and office services supervisor to lead and maintain the facility and office services and the reception area. Responsibilities will include, managing facility project activities including space utilization planning, interior planning, construction, furniture installation, building access and security, and electrical systems, developing range facility plans and facility maintenance. This position will conduct cost analyses as needed to determine business strategies relating to security, service contracts, utilities, housekeeping, furniture, and construction. This position will prepare and monitor project-related schedules to ensure construction, remodel, reconfiguration, and move projects are completed on schedule and within budget. The facilities supervisor will manage outside contractors and oversee completion of work and inspect work to ensure it meets specifications. This position will oversee office services and reception functions. Interview and select candidates for employment in the office services department. This position requires 5 years experience in an Offices Services or Facilities role, ideally at a law firm, strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to multitask, strong negotiation skills, and good Office Suite skills. The firm offers a very competitive salary and excellent benefits, including paid parking downtown. If you are qualified for this position, please email your resume to Director, [email protected] for immediate consideration!

summary: On a daily basis, the cash management specialist will assist existing clients with a digital conversion of their billing and payment processing software. The cash management specialist will also assist customers to transition billing...
description:
On a daily basis, the cash management specialist will assist existing clients with a digital conversion of their billing and payment processing software. The cash management specialist will also assist customers to transition billing records, verifying master billing information to ensure that once the billing system conversion takes place the payments are processed appropriately. The cash management specialist will also help to convert financial services institutions on to the new billing system. The cash management specialist will assist financial services companies, banks and credit unions and small business to set up ACH and EFT payments. The cash management specialist will assist the small businesses, banks and credit unions by arranging, coordinating and administering WebEx conference calls. The cash management specialist will work in a high paced call center environment. The cash management specialist will also handle the following treasury and cash management functions; as well as be familiar with banking terminology such as BSA (Bank Secrecy Act), AML (Anti-Money Laundering), ACH (Automated Clearing House), Hard Token, and Soft Token.

• Effectively & efficiently manages the conversion of assigned business clients 
from legacy platform to new, target platform.
• Mostly small business and less complex business clients (Tier 3) and lower end 
of Tier 2 
• Leads training session(s) over electronic means with client on the phone 
utilizing Skype for business (or equivalent) tool 
• Consults with Clients and Customers to identify additional needs related to the 
products or services 
• Recommends/trains appropriate products, services, or solutions
• Works on assigned client programs
• Performs duties in a courteous, efficient, and detail oriented manner
• Meets/Exceeds Company and client goals for levels of performance
• Responsible for inbound or outbound call segment based on individual 
assignment.
• Ensure security and privacy of customer/client information
• Provide education and support regarding products and services
• Probes to identify client/customer needs and offer appropriate products, 
services, and solutions
• Utilizes available resources appropriately to accurately service 
clients/customers 
• Ensures appropriate follow-through steps are completed for each call
• Maintains complete and accurate records of all call activity as required 
• Maintains a detail oriented appearance and a quality work environment that 
adheres to all safety and security policies
• Monitors individual performance tracking data and provides input for 
Individual Development Plans
• Assists peers with policy and procedural questions
• Successfully completes initial new Digital Conversion detail oriented training 
program and completes all required learning and ongoing training 
 The best candidates for the cash management treasury specialist will have experience processing and setting up ACH, EFT payments. The best candidates for the cash management and treasury specialist will have a Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of one year experience working in a treasury department or as a cash management specialist. The best cash management specialist will be comfortable working in a call center environment making outbound calls to existing customers to educate them on a new software program that will help them with processing payments, payroll and billing for customers. The best cash management specialist will experience conducting WebEx conferences. The cash management specialist should have advanced computer skills and be able to learn and educate others on new software packages in a short period of time.

Using sharp investigative skills, our candidate will review various mediums, including, but not limited to: ORC - Online Registration Center, Sales Force License & Registration, SABOS/AS400, CAESAR, Back office Operating Systems.

• Candidate must be fluent in Microsoft Office.

summary: A large Recycling Company is seeking a Scale Admin! This is a high volume, fast paced position that is very multi-faceted ideal for a candidate that thrives in a non-stop environment!  As a Scale Admin, you will work within a small but...
description:
A large Recycling Company is seeking a Scale Admin! This is a high volume, fast paced position that is very multi-faceted ideal for a candidate that thrives in a non-stop environment! 
As a Scale Admin, you will work within a small but mighty team of three responsible for weighing automobiles and semi-trucks entering and leaving the facility, assisting customers, data collection, generating sales tickets and processing payments. 
A day in the life can include:
•	Properly follow company and OSHA safety procedures.
•	Answering incoming phone calls and emails, giving directions to customers, providing prices, communication with facility manager and other employees
•	Weigh and purchase inbound scrap, obtaining required information from customers for all transactions. Complete purchasing and shipping documents
•	Computation, reconciliation, record keeping, and reporting duties as assigned
•	Calculate payment amount, prepare and issue payment to commercial customers, ACH customers and third-party freight reconciliation
•	Complete ATM reconciliation and cash management practices
•	Prepare outbound shipments paperwork domestic and export
•	Generate and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly reports
•	Assist with month-end closing documents and regular auditing of position related forms
•	Miscellaneous duties as assigned

Contact Accountemps today at (563) 359-3995 to discuss your short- and long-term career goals. Resumes may also be submitted at www.Accountemps.com or email [email protected] 
 We are seeking a Scale Admin with a strong ability to prioritize and organize work in a fast-paced environment. Strengths sought include:
Strong Microsoft Office proficiency (Word, Excel, Outlook)
Strong decision making skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced, non-stop environment while providing excellent customer service and handling multiple projects
Excellent verbal and written communication, organization and time management skills
Demonstrated ability to work well under pressure and meet critical deadlines

description:
TCG is partnering with a growing digital agency in Boulder on their search for a Programmatic Display Manager (team lead). This is a great opportunity to join a team that is expecting to double by next year. The ideal candidate would come from a digital agency with experience planning media as well as client services. This is very much a client facing role but we would prefer someone with a digital media background as well as programmatic media expertise. In this role, you will be responsible for:

- Managing client expectations, objectives, and timelines
- Project Management - owning projects from start to finish and taking full accountability over their successes and failures
- Understanding the essential dynamics, strategies, and drivers of the client's business
- Reading and analyzing data to drive optimization of digital media campaigns
- Understanding digital media buying platforms; such as AdWords, DoubleClick, Facebook, etc. (any ad server/demand side platform technology)
- Presenting reports to client with an ability to be clear and concise as well as knowledgeable about the subject matter
- Managing (complex) digital marketing programs; from defining objectives, to defining tasks, tools, results measurement and ongoing management 
 The MINIMUM qualifications for this position are:

- 5+ years of digital agency media planning experience
- Senior level client services experience and ability to navigate complex client organizations
- Strong proficiency with the Google 360 Marketing stack (Google DoubleClick, Analytics, Tag Manager and AdWords)
- Ability to look at data analytics reports and present them to clients
- Strong management skills
- Desire to learn the latest technologies

If you meet the requirements stated above, please send your resume to [email protected] Only candidates who meet these requirements will be contacted.

description:
A growing healthcare organization is looking for an analytical Medical Records Reviewer. This role involves examining and assessing provider documentation to ensure patient severity of illness and health acuity is accurately reflected. This is accomplished by performing review of various types of patient medical records from multiple settings. These assessments will also provide guidance for ongoing provider coaching and training. 

Primary job duties: 
•	Perform paper and electronic medical chart review 
•	Review and abstract paper and electronic medical records using HEDIS® Technical Specifications as it relates to the company’s clinical quality initiatives
•	Perform accurate data entry and seek out patterns of missing documentation of additional records
•	Meet organizational standards of proper turnaround time for HEDIS® record review 
•	Abide by all HIPAA and associated patient confidentiality requirements
•	Facilitate and obtain appropriate provider documentation for any clinical conditions or procedures to support the appropriate severity of illness, expected risk of mortality, and complexity of care for the patient

Requirements:
•	Strong medical terminology
•	1+ years of hands on medical records review & analysis or a Certified Medical Coder
•	Analytical and detail oriented

Preferred:
•	HEDIS software experience (data entry, reporting)
• Clinical degree, i.e. RN, LVN, LPN or similar clinical role
•	Medical record review (vendor, health plan, health insurance or hospital setting)
•	Quality assurance
•	Experience working in EMR systems
•	ICD-9 & 10

-Prepare balance sheet, profit and loss statement, and other reports to summarize current and projected company financial position.
-Audit contracts, orders, and vouchers, and prepare reports to substantiate individual transactions prior to monthly close process.
-Establish, modify, document, and coordinate the implementation of accounting and accounting control procedures.
-Prepare, examine, or analyze accounting records, financial statements, or other financial reports to assess accuracy, completeness, and conformance to reporting and procedural standards.
-Report to management regarding the finances of establishment.
-Establish tables of accounts and assign entries to proper accounts. 

Job Requirements:

We are looking for a degreed Junior Staff Accountant with a solid work ethic, excellent judgment, and a desire to build a long-term career with us. You should be highly organized and detail-oriented, with outstanding analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you are able to work effectively with minimal oversight, while also functioning well in a team environment. 


EXPERIENCE PREFERRED FOR THE JUNIOR STAFF ACCOUNTANT ROLE:
-BS degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
-General Accounting
-Attention to detail
-Excellent written and verbal communication skills
-Corporate accounting / General ledger experience
-Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently with minimal direction

Our client, a growing technology company just a few miles south of Newport’s Fashion Island Mall is looking for someone to join their accounting team in Accounts Payable. This reputable firm has several opening in their accounting department due to growth and could jump start your career in accounting. 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

Accounting (95%)
-Performs all Accounts Payable functions including receipt of vendor invoices, proper general ledger coding, management approvals, accounting system management, check generation and distribution.
-Processes all corporate credit card receipts, including distribution of statements, compilation of receipts and reviewing coding information from all card holders.
-Assists with the month-end close by reconciling general ledger accounts, petty cash, bank accounts and preparing journal entries.
-Prepares, reviews for accuracy & analysis, and distributes month-end budget to actual reports to internal managers.
-Maintains Fixed Assets schedules, prepares and posts monthly depreciation entries.
-Maintains and reconciles schedule for prepaid expense and exhibits.
-Posts journal entries that are prepared by HR staff including, bi-weekly payroll journal entry, monthly medical, dental and vision allocation expense, workman's compensation and unemployment insurance allocation, accrued PTO.
-Makes weekly cash deposit trip to bank and gets front desk and store change orders.
-Prepares regulatory tax returns including sales tax, capital expenditures, and welfare exemption.
-Assists with the annual financial audit, including preparation of audit schedules, documentation review, and response to auditors’ requests.
-Oversees petty cash, refills and maintains ATM machine as required.
-Filing of invoices and scanning monthly reconciliations.
-Prepares 1099-Misc annually.
-Reconciles front desk and store cash twice per year.
-Assists Controller with the preparation and maintenance of budgets and projections.
-Assists in the preparation and maintenance of accounting procedures manuals.
-Assists with Accounts Receivable as needed.
-Performs ad hoc financial analysis as required.

Other Duties (5%)
-Opens and distributes mail.
-Provides backup to Staff Accountant - Accounts Receivable and other Finance staff members.
-Assists with major BADM wide events as required.
-Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

-BS in Accounting or related field required.
-Knowledge of accounting processes, reporting, and reconciliation of financial information.
-One to three years of accounting experience.
-Excellent oral and written communication skills.
-Solid working knowledge of Excel, Word, and accounting software.
-Not-for-profit and fund accounting experience preferred.
-Ability to work both as an individual performer and as part of a team to proactively problem solve.
-Highly motivated, flexible, resourceful, well-organized and detail-oriented.
-Demonstrated record of setting and achieving goals and meeting deadlines.
-Must be detail oriented and organized with time and data.

This Graphic Designer position is a contract-to-hire opportunity, based in the Denver, Colorado area. Talented, ambitious, and experienced Junior Graphic Designers are encouraged to apply for the position today.

Your responsibilities

- Develop images used in a variety of creative projects, which could include presentations, brochures, advertisements, catalogs, direct mail, corporate identity, packaging and web/mobile sites

- Video editing experience a plus

description:
*****ALL POSITIONS ARE CONTRACT TO FULL-TIME BASED ON PERFORMANCE******

The Registered Agent Assistant has the primary responsibility of supporting our registered agent team in building and maintaining relationships with the BizFilings customer base. 
Activities include: learning the complex and comprehensive BizFilings products and services and related jurisdiction regulations; placing, reviewing and fulfilling incoming orders; logging and forwarding important state or legal mailings/notifications to our customers. 
The registered agent assistant plays an important role in contributing to customer satisfaction and representing within the industry and territory 
 The registered agent assistant will be responsible for the following duties which include but are not limited to: 

• Logging and mailing out registered agent communications. 
• Scrubbing data. 
• Filing annual reports (paper and online). 
• Reviewing orders for accuracy. 
• Order placement. 

Skills/Qualifications: 
• College degree 
• 1 year of experience working with Microsoft Office Suite (e.g. Word, Excel, Outlook) 
• Able to type 40 wpm 
• Detail Oriented 
• Integrating information from multiple sources quickly and accurately. 
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
• Gathering and analyzing data 
• Team player 
• Ability to multitask and prioritize

description:
TCG is looking for a designer for one of our clients in Research Triangle Park, North Carolina ASAP! The role is full-time, 40 hours a week, and on a contract on a month by month basis. There is also potential for hire down the line. The client's merchandising team is looking for a designer to help design point of purchase displays and put together 3D renderings for in-store displays. The designer should understand in-store processes, have experience designing displays, etc. A retail background is another plus skill. There is some remote flexibility, but the client would prefer the designer to come into the office occasionally or work onsite. 
 Requirements: 
CINEMA 4D
1-2+ years of experience 
Positive, hardworking attitude

summary: CPA firm seeks a licensed Enrolled Agent with 2+ years’ experience as a tax preparer. Responsible for tax preparation of individual, partnership, corporate and fiduciary returns of varying complexity; as well as write-up, review, adjusting...
description:
CPA firm seeks a licensed Enrolled Agent with 2+ years’ experience as a tax preparer. Responsible for tax preparation of individual, partnership, corporate and fiduciary returns of varying complexity; as well as write-up, review, adjusting and closing of books for business clients.

Responsibilities:
•Interview clients to obtain additional information on taxable income and deductible expenses and allowances.
•Use all appropriate adjustments, deductions, and credits to keep clients' taxes to a minimum.
•Prepare or assist in preparing simple to complex tax returns for individuals or small businesses.
•Compute taxes owed or overpaid, using adding machines or personal computers, and complete entries on forms, following tax form instructions and tax tables.
•Furnish taxpayers with sufficient information and advice to ensure correct tax form completion.
•Check data input or verify totals on forms prepared by others to detect errors in arithmetic, data entry, or procedures.
•Consult tax law handbooks or bulletins to determine procedures for preparation of atypical returns.
•Calculate form preparation fees according to return complexity and processing time required.
•Answer questions and provide future tax planning to clients. Review financial records such as income statements and documentation of expenditures to determine forms needed to prepare tax returns.
•Explain federal and state tax laws to individuals and companies.

If interested, please apply or send resume to [email protected] 
 Qualifications:
-Bachelor’s degree with 2+ years’ experience in tax preparation
-Enrolled Agent license/certification
-Experience with Intuit Lacerte and Intuit QuickBooks preferred, additional tax software experience considered

summary: Our client, a small Managed Service provider for a very small set of clients, is seeking a Helpdesk Manager who has a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth. Our client is seeking an experienced IT...
description:
Our client, a small Managed Service provider for a very small set of clients, is seeking a Helpdesk Manager who has a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth. Our client is seeking an experienced IT manager who will be responsible for leading the daily activities of the helpdesk team and along with supporting IT operations. You will be responsible for facilitating employee development by coaching, motivating and leading by example to obtain new skill sets, knowledge and troubleshooting techniques. An additional focus of this role is the improvement of documented solutions logged by the service desk.

Duties will include:
•	Leading the daily activities of all IT Help Desk functions and IT operations
•	Continually assesses productivity and call activity in order to ensure maximum performance and support service standards to the fullest extent
•	Sets and communicates goals and provides constructive feedback to create a high performance culture
•	Effectively communicates decisions to achieve understanding and acceptance of changes and/or direction
•	Collaborates with IT Operations to help meet the key operational objectives of the Company, along with providing seamless support to the end user
•	Collaborates with internal departments to rollout new initiatives, programs, systems, automation enhancements, and other technical solutions
•	Provides timely escalation and initiates remediation efforts by engaging appropriate teams

For immediate consideration please email resume to: [email protected] 
 •	2+ years of leadership experience within an IT Help Desk setting
•	Proven ability to manage multiple tasks, stay organized, and effectively handle shifting priorities in a dynamic work environment
•	Demonstrated ability to positively lead a team in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
•	Strong working knowledge of IT system fundamentals
•	Strong analytical and organizational skills, as well as accuracy and attention to detail
•	Ability to provide timely feedback related to customer service
•	Ability to explain technical concepts and adjust messaging based on the audience, including non-technical groups
•	Ability to influence through outstanding interpersonal skills, collaboration, and negotiation skills

jobtitle: Client Service Manager - Financial Planning Firm
summary: For immediate consideration, please email your resume to [email protected]  Our Client is a comprehensive financial services firm committed to helping our clients improve their long-term financial success. Our Client has...
description:
For immediate consideration, please email your resume to [email protected]

Our Client is a comprehensive financial services firm committed to helping our clients improve their long-term financial success. Our Client has provided personalized solutions for individuals and business owners since 1950. As an independently owned and operated firm, their advisors have no requirement to represent proprietary solutions or products. This independence allows them to keep intense focus on assisting clients to achieve their personalized goals and financial aspirations, as opposed to meeting specific product sales quotas. 

They are seeking a high level, serious individual with financial services industry background, and professional demeanor suitable for interaction with an experienced, professional and active clientele to act as practice manager for one of their top producing wealth management advisors. This person will be responsible for overseeing all client service and operational duties of the advisor’s practice, which includes:

- Process new account paperwork
- Resolve routine and complex client service issues in a thorough and expeditious manner, utilizing sound judgment with an emphasis on courtesy and communication
- Leading weekly team meetings 
- Help create and maintain practice operations and governance 
- Heavy client Interaction
- Working with firm’s trader for performing trade, rebalancing, and distribution requests
- Track and manage all aspects of asset movement 
- Maintain comprehensive knowledge of, and interact with, the multiple investment management platforms
- Maintain strong working relationship with financial planning team 
- Keep the practice up to date on all compliance activities 
- Manage onboarding process with new clients including communication 
- Coordinate activities with firms’ service team regarding specific tasks
- Manage team’s client data base systems/CRM 
 - Bachelor’s degree

Robert Half has immediate opportunities for an Operations Legal Processor to support a national corporate client's office in Tempe, AZ. This is an entry level supporting role within their legal department. All candidates must have strong computer skills and be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Experience in legal and financial services appreciated but not required. Training may be provided to new team members regarding both internal processes and external state specific statues.

•	Track documents, and file court documents and legal orders.

•	Experience in a professional office, administrative, data entry, legal, financial, or processing role
•	Exposure to legal or financial documentation preferred, but not required.

•	Proficient in Microsoft Office 
•	Flexibility to quickly learn new processes and tasks.

Qualifications:
•	Candidates should have a positive disposition and take initiative.
•	It is essential that candidates be able to work well in a team environment as well as independently.

Experience with: Enterprise Logging and Monitoring tools; Enterprise Log Management ELM; 
Network Architecture; Experience with SIEM Security Information & Event Management; Experience monitoring an enterprise log management server and infrastructure for systems optimization; Advanced systems administration with Linux operating systems; Experience working with GrayLog, Splunk, Understand Elasticsearch technologies; and SolarWinds. Scripting experience is a must. Technical Lead experience is a plus, not required!

* Automation experience

* Ability to communicate with Senior management and throughout the organization in a leadership capacity! 
* Certifications are a plus!

 * Systems Engineering experience

* Establishing metrics 
* Automation

* Managing an offshore team is a plus! 
* Scripting experience, Powershell scripting is a plus. 
* Ability to communicate with Senior management and throughout the organization in a leadership capacity! 
* Certifications are a plus! 
* For immediate & Confidential consideration contact Carrie Danger : [email protected] 
* No Third Party inquires please! Or C2C!

summary: Robert Half has an exciting leadership opportunity in our Georgia market, and we are currently recruiting for a Branch Manager for our Alpharetta team.  Join one of the World’s Most Admired Companies!  The Branch Manager works in an...
description:
Robert Half has an exciting leadership opportunity in our Georgia market, and we are currently recruiting for a Branch Manager for our Alpharetta team.

Join one of the World’s Most Admired Companies!

The Branch Manager works in an exciting team environment with responsibility for leadership of the team, hiring and developing recruiting and support staff, and using his/her proven background to develop and grow a client base. The person in this role will work with regional management to generate an annual budget and business plan, and provide day-to-day leadership to his/her direct reports. We will provide you with world-class training, client-relationship management tools and back-office support, as well as a compensation program that is second to none.

If you have demonstrated success in business development and management and are looking for an exciting new career with a great earning potential, please apply below.

Job Summary

As a Branch Manager, your responsibilities will include:
• Leadership
o	Motivating and directing to all branch employees. 
o	Incrementally growing branch revenue consistent with Robert Half targets.
o	Providing quality customer service to both clients and candidates.

• Hiring, coaching, mentoring, and developing recruiting and support staff
o	Reviewing monthly activities for all direct reports. 
o	Actively leading marketing activities as an involved manager.
o	Creating and maintaining a culture of performance; and facilitating cross-promotion activities for all divisions.

• Developing and growing a client base
o	Using your proven business development and management background to develop and grow your own client base by marketing our services for temporary, project and/or full-time staffing solutions. 
o	Conducting telephone and in-person meetings with key managers and senior-level executives, for the purpose of prospecting new business and identifying key staffing needs. 
o	Using a consultative approach, recommending and providing staffing solutions to clients; meeting with candidates for client meetings as necessary. 
o	Solidifying Robert Half’s presence in the local marketplace through consistent participation in networking organizations and events.
o	Working with Regional Management to generate an annual budget and business plan, and provide day-to-day supervision and leadership to his/her direct reports. 
o	Supervising the administrative functions of the office.

Top Reasons to Work for Robert Half:
•	EXCITING CAREER OPPORTUNITIES WITH THE INDUSTRY LEADER – For more than 70 years our history of success and strong client relationships has provided a level of stability few companies can match.
•	PERFORMANCE = REWARD – We offer exceptional earning potential and a competitive benefits package, including a base salary and monthly performance-based bonuses, paid time off, group health, life and disability insurance, and retirement savings plans.
•	UPWARD MOBILITY – With more than 300 staffing locations worldwide, we provide excellent career advancement potential, both locally and beyond.
•	TOOLS FOR SUCCESS – We provide world-class training, client relationship management tools and advanced technology to help you succeed.
•	RESPECTED WORLDWIDE – Robert Half has appeared on Fortune® magazine’s list of “World's Most Admired Companies” since 1998, as well as numerous “Best Places to Work” lists around the world.


For immediate consideration please forward your resume to [email protected] 
 •	An Accounting/Finance degree is required with an accounting designation highly desirable.
•	Experience in a public accounting firm or corporate accounting or finance department required.
•	Must be able to demonstrate excellent communication and problem-solving skills, a strong desire to succeed and ability to leverage accounting/finance experience to manage and grow your business. 
•	3+ years’ experience in business development and management is required.
•	Must be articulate, proactive, able to teach, willing to suggest process improvements and able to interact with senior management. 


For immediate consideration please forward your resume to [email protected]
