summary: Robert Half Technology is actively looking for a Contact Center Engineer for a 9-12 month contract only.  The Contact Center Engineer will be responsible for the architecture, design, and operational support of customer interaction...
description:
Robert Half Technology is actively looking for a Contact Center Engineer for a 9-12 month contract only.

The Contact Center Engineer will be responsible for the architecture, design, and operational support of customer interaction applications and infrastructure globally for inbound contact centers. This will encompass ACD platforms and services, contact routing, automation and CTI, self-service (IVR), call recording, workforce management and speech and data analytics. This position will focus on customer interaction applications that will often leverage WAN/LAN services provided by and requiring heavy involvement from the Network Engineering team. 

Position Responsibilities:
•Analyzing business needs and recommending solutions that enable client's customer-engagement strategy
•Following client's project management standards and working through internal and external resources, to deliver successful projects on time and within budget
•Maintaining current technical knowledge of the contact center landscape in order to drive the implementation of innovative applications and services that facilitate human or automated interactions with our customers
•Providing end-to-end service management oversight of customer interaction technology
•Leading the transformation of client's customer interactions technology from a premise-based client managed infrastructure model to an API-led cloud and CCaaS model; rationalizing legacy systems and reducing overall cost envelope of legacy servers, carrier services, data centers and computer rooms
•Coordinating with the Network Engineering, Systems Engineering, and Global Information Security teams for new and in-service systems to optimize and integrate such systems within the global network, telephony, and systems environment, following Hilton standards and high-level IT goals and objectives and resolving support issues
•Working closely with internal and external resources on applications or services that provide or integrate with customer interaction services to deploy, integrate, instrument, optimize and monitor performance, as well as support new client initiatives within an end-to-end services framework
•Serving as subject matter expert for the integration of customer interaction services and the data and events that flow between these systems and other services within the client's ecosystem
•Develop and maintain documentation for Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery
•Design and participate in Disaster Recovery exercises for Contact Center communications systems
•Manage documentation on all methods and processes to prevent technical issues or services outages
•Travel up to 25% 
 Position Qualifications:

•5+ years working with contact center technology including networking and telecommunications engineering, telephony systems (including ACD and call automation), contact center operations, vendor and service management and security
•5+ years technical experience
•3+ years in vendor and service management, including cloud-based services
•2+ years of project management experience
•BA/BS bachelor’s degree
•Demonstrated experience with key telephony and telecommunications tools and technologies (VoIP, T1/PRI, WAN/LAN, WebRTC, SBC, SIP, Wireshark)
•Proven track record of successful architecture, design and building of contact center applications, including but not limited to, ACD (Avaya, Cisco, Amazon Connect), IVR, CTI, call recording, speech and text analytics, and workforce management
•Proven ability to solve problems and apply critical thinking skills, interpret inputs and make sound decisions
•Comfortable working in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment with often-ambiguous business requirements and multiple competing priorities
•Requires off-hours and on-call work

description:
1. Design fixture plans, interior finish plans, details sheets & schedules using AutoCAD. 
2. Layout and design initial site development plans. 
3. Coordinate bid set plans and specifications for construction between architects & engineers. 
4. Work with Architects to develop exterior building design concepts.

12. Prepare overall project cost estimates to include building construction & equipment total costs. 
13. Coordinate interior décor design with décor contractors and owners. 
14. Coordinate with store services for member owner shelving, refrigeration and equipment needs. 
 • Basic Computer knowledge (AutoCAD, Excel & Word programs)

• Detail oriented 
• Good Negotiator

• Math: Using business math, statistics & geometry. 
• Language: Reading manuals, writing summaries & business letters and simple communication in English.

summary: Our Client here in Oklahoma City is looking for a Jr. Project Coordinator. The Project Coordinator will provide project management experience to the Information Technology Division. This position will work closely with IT management. The...
description:
Our Client here in Oklahoma City is looking for a Jr. Project Coordinator. The Project Coordinator will provide project management experience to the Information Technology Division. This position will work closely with IT management. The project coordinator will be in charge of assisting the IT management team in organizing ongoing projects. This will involve monitoring project plans, schedules, create and track project tasks, organizing and participating in stakeholder meetings and ensuring that project deadlines are met in a timely manner. 

As an IT Team Member, each person must have flexibility in the duties they perform. Tasks may include operational responsibilities not directly related to projects, but will be within the professional’s core skill set.

Principle Responsibilities: (Essential Function)
· Coordinate the efforts of team members and, where appropriate, third parties in order to deliver the project according to requirements.
· Ensuring projects are moving forward and the individual status of each project is known and can be communicated swiftly and concisely to the Management team.
· Closely liaison with project team members and stakeholders on an on-going basis.
· Work with Project Managers and IT Management to eliminate blockers.
· Developing and delivering progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation and presentations as required by the Management team.
· Undertaking project tasks as required.
· Assist Management team with process improvement and other duties not specifically related to a project.
· Providing administrative support as needed

Please contact Nicole Crosby at 405-236-0202, or email your resume to [email protected] if you are interested! I look forward to working with you!

summary: Client In Flagstaff Arizona looking for a Help Desk Tier 3 to start Monday April 15th. Will need to drive down to Tucson once a month for a weeks time.   RESPONSIBILITIES  •	Strong customer service orientation.  •	Provide world class...
description:
Client In Flagstaff Arizona looking for a Help Desk Tier 3 to start Monday April 15th. Will need to drive down to Tucson once a month for a weeks time. 

RESPONSIBILITIES 
•	Strong customer service orientation. 
•	Provide world class customer support. 
•	First level response to incident tickets. 
•	Accept and solve 2nd tier support issues. 
•	Migrate and deploy PC images. 
•	Function and communicate in a global support team. 
•	Respond to ticketing incidents by priority and assignment. 
•	Support customers through superb communication in person, by telephone and or email. 
•	Fully document resolution and communication history to customer in incident ticket. 
•	If appropriate, convert resolution to knowledge base document to share with other team members. 
•	Diagnose, analyze, and resolve PC and software problems for internal customers through incident ticketing system. 
•	Keen attention to detail. 
•	Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. 
•	Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. 
•	Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. 
•	On-call availability. 
•	Some evening and weekend hours. 
•	Analyze root cause and implement corrective solutions. 
•	Create OS images for all models of PCs using Acronis (or other imaging software) and maintain documentation. 
•	Deploy new equipment to customers from unpacking to desktop. 
•	Assess the need for performance upgrades to PCs, including the installation of NIC cards, hard drives, RAM, memory chips, CD-ROMs, and so on. 
•	Collaborate with LAN/WAN administrators to ensure efficient operation of the company’s infrastructure for our customers. 
•	Assist in resolving issues with customers on server based software products. 
•	When working on any PC, ensure latest security settings, antivirus, application patches are applied. 
•	Assist Customer Care Center Application Technician with software releases and rollouts. 
•	Backup to Customer Care Center Administrator when not in the office or when call or email volume is excessive. 
•	Assist in moves, adds, and changes (MACs) submitted to the Customer Care Center. 
•	Ensure that physical desktop connections (i.e. RJ-45 Ethernet jacks, RJ-11 telephone modem jacks, connectors between PCs and servers, etc.) are in proper working order. 
•	Use tools and applications for monitoring desktop performance and provide performance statistics and reports. 
•	Basic SQL reporting skill or ability and willingness to learn. 
•	Create documentation and populate the knowledge base with articles when needed. 
•	Assist in preparing, maintaining, and upholding procedures for logging, and reporting for Customer Care Center operations. 
•	Maintain inventory of all hardware and software. 
•	When necessary, contact third-party support and PC equipment vendors. 
•	Conduct research on desktop products in support of continuously improving the Customer Care Center service. 
•	Assist in defining computer configurations. 
•	Escalate unresolvable issues to the Customer Care Center Application Technician or Administrator.

description:
A booming outdoor company is seeking a Digital Merchandising Coordinator to assist their team during a peak season. 

The Digital Merchandiser shares responsibility for the customer experience and revenue generation across the website managed directly by the Merchandising Team. They will support the day-to-day management of the website including building and optimizing content, merchandising products and catalogs to maximize sales, supporting conversion rate optimization, supporting new product launches, and planning/executing promotions.


Please contact [email protected], [email protected] for more information on this position 
 RESPONSIBILITIES

Maintain existing product catalog to drive discoverability of products within the catalog: merchandise product into taxonomy to drive sales, add product into any new categories, create new categories where appropriate to drive sales.
Prepare new product for launch in our back end system:
Create manufacturers in the GovX ecommerce platform
Include all key brand information: warranty information, made in the must be eligible to work in the U.S. status, charitable causes, and support for the GovX audience.
Upload new products into the ecommerce system by formatting in excel.
Add product images, add product descriptions and key features, merchandise into appropriate categories within the taxonomy, and add facets to allow products to be filtered within the taxonomy.
Work collaboratively to enhance product pages with video content, educational content, additional product specs and relevant customer feedback.
Manage and maintain product and campaign launch schedules implemented by the Marketing Team.
Dive into landing pages for all marketing to make sure they are assorted to drive the highest conversion from marketing.
Improve profitability by suggesting and evaluating creative merchandising initiatives and growth strategies – using product promotions, focused shops, website design optimization, and more.
Evaluate and maintain effective taxonomy, facets and shop strategies that facilitate efficient search, reinforce a positive brand experience and support effective visual merchandising.
Manages content and keywords to maximize relevant results within on-site search.


REQUIREMENTS

2 years’ experience in an office environment, e-commerce or merchandising background preferred.
Bachelor's Degree (BA) or equivalent from four-year college or university.
Attention to detail and ability to maintain accuracy when switching between tasks.
Strong analytical and organizational skills, ability to multi-task and prioritize.
Problem solver with the ability to think creatively to solve problems.
Team player with strong communication skills and the ability to work cross functionally.
Strong expertise in Excel.
Willingness to learn quickly and thrive in an ever-changing environment
Displays resourcefulness while working under limited supervision, in order to gain a thorough understanding of the many complex systems and tools used on a daily basis

description:
A prestigious healthcare group in the El Segundo area is seeking a talented LVN RN Inpatient Nurse Case Manager to join their organization. The LVN RN Inpatient Nurse Case Manager will provide daily care coordination, DRG review, case management, referral processing, consultation and intervention to patients with one or more chronic diseases. The LVN RN Inpatient Nurse Case Manager is responsible for identifying said population via provider/clinic referral, utilization management referral, disease registry reporting mechanisms and patient self-referral. This position will also provide case management to patients who are admitted to the hospital and those patients who may need to be enrolled in ambulatory case management. Works as part of an interdisciplinary care team coordinating managed care population. The LVN RN Inpatient Nurse Case Manager effectively collaborates with members of the interdisciplinary care team and with the physician in the clinic. 

Please email resume to [email protected] 
 - Must have RN or LVN certifications
- 3+ Years of authorization and referral processing experience in an Inpatient setting
- Strong understanding of HMO and PPO processes
- 1+ Year working in a Managed Care setting

description:
Seeking Customer Service Representatives!



OfficeTeam has a fulfilling career opportunity for an articulate, highly-skilled Customer Service Representative in the growing Hi Tech Engineering industry. Do you wish to take your social skills and put them to work to further the growth of an awesome business? This will be a fantastic next step in your career. This position is based in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. If you're looking for a long-term temporary engagement, and can work in Petaluma, California, this could be the Customer Service Representative position for you!

Your responsibilities:
Areas of Responsibility: 
•	Analyse and process customer quotations and purchase orders. Enter orders into the sales order system and prepare sequence information for database import using Excel. 
•	Import daily orders into FileMaker database, perform double-check for accuracy and make corrections as necessary. 
•	Assign oligos to the proper lab machine for synthesis. 
•	Take customer phone calls for order placement, order status, and pricing information. 
•	Provide general customer support via phone and email regarding their orders and our products and services. 
•	Generate, review, and send order confirmations and quotations. 
•	File customer communications in Outlook. 
•	Train and cross-train in the everyday functions of the department, within and outside of FileMaker. 
•	Track all custom orders daily, noting all late orders and remakes for special handling in the absence of the Custom Order Supervisor. 
•	Assist with miscellaneous other duties related to the work of the department, as assigned. 

•	A positive and caring approach to our customers. We strive to give our customers the best customer service possible. 
•	Extraordinary attention to detail for both customer requirements and departmental procedures, with a commitment to accuracy. 
•	Flexibility as our department evolves in order to meet new customer and company needs. 
•	The ability to be highly organized and thrive in a busy, multi-tasking environment. 
•	Patience and an appreciation for learning every day, with the goal of continuous improvement. 
•	The aptitude to learn quickly and retain new information. 
•	The capability to work independently and as team player; professionally giving and receiving helpful feedback. 

If interested, please send current resume and three supervisory references to [email protected] 
 - Demonstrated talents in communicating and interacting with clients/customers, both internal and external
- 2+ years' experience of proven performance in a goal-driven & customer-focused environment desired
- Positive attitude and an engaging businesslike approach
- Purchasing experience preferred
- Database management experience
- Knowledge of data entry
- Solid understanding of customer service
- Adeptness in Microsoft Outlook
- Deep understanding of Microsoft Office
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills
- No stranger to performing extensive research to resolve complex customer inquiries
- Excellent customer service and office administrative skills
- Critical thinking, problem solving, ability to work independently
- Excellent computer skills



If you derive detail oriented and personal satisfaction from the expert application of customer service on a case-by-case basis, we want to hear from you. Apply today!

summary: Lease Administrator:   If you're looking to join a thriving, fast-paced company that recognizes talent and effort, Robert Half Finance is seeking an ambitious, detail-oriented Lease Administrator for a growing company based in the...
description:
Lease Administrator: 

If you're looking to join a thriving, fast-paced company that recognizes talent and effort, Robert Half Finance is seeking an ambitious, detail-oriented Lease Administrator for a growing company based in the Bloomfield, MI area. This company offers a challenging and multi-faceted opportunity where effort is rewarded. This position requires a high energy and self-motivated individual who's primary focus will be on the day-to-day lease administration and accounting for retail tenants and related properties. This exciting position will interface with multiple other departments within the company and will serve to be an excellent learning opportunity for intellectually and curious and motivated candidates.

Your responsibilities

• Ensure that all property and tenant information is up to date and correct through lease interpretation and cross-referencing against other property information 
• Ensure accuracy of all tenant account information 
• Perform quarterly/annual CAM analyses/reconciliations and assemble the necessary detailed supporting documentation for tenants 
• Calculate and prepare budgeted tenant CAM estimates, year-end reconciliations, CPI adjustments and percentage rent 
• Prepare management reports, including budget, insurance, tax and CAM information
 • Responsible for collection of all outstanding AR balances including preparation of tenant default and demand notices if necessary 
• Monitor bank accounts for all deposits and disbursements 
• Work collaboratively with Property Managers to resolve accounting issues, solve business problems and improve processes 
• Assist with other property related tenant accounting as needed
 • Develop/maintain accurate and current standard operating procedures documentation 
• Respond to internal and external data requests from auditors and communicate effectively to resolve problems
 • Research complex issues and suggest resolutions 
• Participate in strategic planning/growth for the department and company 
• Participate in special projects individually or as part of a cross-functional team

If this sounds like the position for you, please contact Blake Reedy at 248-205-5582 ext:48136 or [email protected] 
 • Minimum of three to five years of business experience required
• Associate or Bachelor degree preferred
• Experience with collections preferred
• Experience working with and interpreting commercial real estate leases preferred
• Flexible and able to work independently and in a team environment
• Ability to apply effective problem-solving skills
• Strong analytical skills with attention to detail
• Experience with Sage 300 Construction and Real Estate software preferred
• Advanced Microsoft Excel skills including V-Lookups and Pivot Tables preferred

description:
Robert Half Government - the staffing division of Protiviti Government Services is currently hiring on a Client Systems Technician for one our government clients. The Client Systems Technician needs to have 3 years of experience as a Client Systems Technician with a certification of, or similar to a CompTIA Security+ and an Active Secret Clearance. The Client Systems Technician should have experience with Microsoft Windows 10. This position requires an Active Secret clearance prior to start. 

Responsibilities and Duties:

-Possess a strong desire to provide excellent customer service solutions and interact with coworkers and clients in a courteous and detail oriented manner.
-Provide end user device support to include all aspects to resolve customer incidents including, but not limited to; installing, connecting, troubleshooting, repairing, and deploying laptop/desktop hardware and all networked and non-network peripherals and software.
-Provide troubleshooting and remedy for IT related incidents or requests escalated from the Service desk utilizing remote access, if necessary, to isolate and resolve issues, or refer the incident to the next level of support.
-Utilize a wide range of tools to address issues, to install or reinstall software if authorized and required.
If incidents cannot be fixed remotely, onsite (at employees office location) support will be required.
-Plan, track, configure, install, and migrate user data and settings for new laptops/desktops for base users.
-Provide integration, testing, evaluation, configuration control, and administration of laptop/desktop systems hardware and software as well as perform integration and standardization of desktop hardware and software as required.
-Install the client baseline image along with other authorized software, as required. 
 Required Skills 

Must have CompTIA Security+ CE Certification in good standing or other DoD 8570 IAT Level II or better certifications.
Industry certifications (Microsoft Windows 10, etc.) preferred.

Required Experience 

-Minimum one to five years of end user desktop support experience required.
-Associates’ Degree in IT-related field preferred but not required.
-Extensive computer & desktop support knowledge required.
-Must have or be able to obtain a DoD Secret Level Clearance.

summary: Position Summary: The QA/RA Administrator is responsible for reviewing and updating Quality Management System to align with current regulatory standards and guidance documents applicable to IVD/Medical Device (FDA 21 CFR 820, ISO13485:...
description:
Position Summary:
The QA/RA Administrator is responsible for reviewing and updating Quality Management System to align with current regulatory standards and guidance documents applicable to IVD/Medical Device (FDA 21 CFR 820, ISO13485: current, MDSAP, IVDR, etc.) conducting internal quality audits, supplier audits, corrective and preventive actions, complaint handling and non-conforming material process.
Key Responsibilities:
•	Coordinate and assist with efforts associated with the preparation of regulatory documents or submissions.
•	Coordinate, prepare and review regulatory submissions for domestic and international projects.
•	Maintain current knowledge base of existing and emerging regulations, standards or guidance documents.
•	Provide regulatory review of customer complaints including risk review and adverse event reporting where applicable.
•	Oversee and complete company licensing requirements per requirements of FDA,EU and Canada.
•	Maintain CE registrations and Technical Files as required.
•	Assist QA and Supply Chain personnel with the internal audit program by preparing audit schedules, agendas, and metrics for senior management.
•	Perform internal audits; generate audit reports and follow-up on audit observations.
•	Ensure completion of audit documentation in a timely manner according to existing procedure.
•	Administer corrective and preventive action; issue CAPAs resulting from internal audits, supplier audits, NCMRs and other areas; monitors corrective action plans, verify the effectiveness of preventive and corrective actions as required by performing audits or assigning audits as part of audit planning.
•	Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
Education and Experience:
•	Associates Degree or higher with a minimum of 3 to 5 years Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs work experience in Medical Device including FDA CFR 820, ISO 13485:current, MDSAP, IVDR, etc.
•	Competent with all aspects of a Quality Management System including CAPA, NCMR, MRBs, System auditing standards and procedures.
•	Experience writing training programs, reports, and documents. Effective verbal skills for training and communications with personnel at all levels, both inside and outside the organization.
•	Ability to perform in a fast paced and demanding environment.
•	Effective oral and written communication skills targeted at all levels within the company. Including strong skills in interpersonal, collaborative team building, meeting facilitation and presentation.
•	Experienced in the use of personal computer, including high level of proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
•	Training and Auditing experience required. 
 ISO Quality Standards, QA - Quality Assurance, Regulatory Compliance, SAP, Supply Chain Management, Auditing
3+ years of experience with Quality Assurance/Regulatory Affairs
Regulatory Affairs work experience in Medical Device including FDA CFR 820, ISO 13485
For immediate consideration, please email resume to [email protected] and call Mike Craig @ 508.898.0900

The Role:
The entry level Art Director is expected to exhibit outstanding design judgment and work collaboratively with the writing and design team in achieving the highest possible standards for all materials, requiring design across all social media channels. The role requires working knowledge of clients’ business challenges and the ability to lead art direction to address specific social media marketing objectives.

•	Partner with Social Media Marketing Teams and agency partners on the development of social aspects of integrated campaigns 
•	Deep knowledge of social channels and design principles for all social platforms
•	Able to create nuanced artwork for campaigns which span multiple social channels
•	Appetite to create assets for testing and optimizing based on performance data
•	Manage, update and maintain existing library of images and social films
•	Execute the concept and design of marketing assets as prescribed by creative/marketing briefs
•	Provide art direction on small-and large-scale projects from creative conception to completion

description:
We are working with a growing government contracting Technical Firm who is looking for an individual to handle all personnel and facility clearances. The ideal candidate selected for the Facility Security Officer (FSO) role will be responsible for maintaining security programs for active contracts and awarded contracts. Responsibilities of the internal Facility Security Officer (FSO) role include the processing of federal security clearances, record maintenance, understanding of all Intelligence Community and DoD security requirements, safe-guarding, administering security training programs and preparing visit requests. This Facility Security Officer (FSO) position requires independent judgment and confidentiality. Daily duties will include conducting new employee briefings, exit interviews and debriefings, investigating and reporting security violations, incident reports, and coordination of periodic re-investigations and preparation of DD254 forms for subcontractors. Annual duties include preparing training, self-inspections and DSS security reviews.


If you are interested in this position, please submit a resume in word format to Leila Hermes at Robert Half at [email protected] or call Leila Hermes at Robert Half at 703-437-7723 or contact your recruiting manager if you are already working with Robert Half.

- Must have Degree (bachelor’s preferred)
- FSO Certification, or other security related education, strongly preferred
- 2+ years Facility Security Officer (FSO) experience or 5+ years as a Personnel Security Specialist (PSS)
- Must have utilized JPAS, and strong understanding of NISPOM, safe-guarding
- ISO, IO and ISM experience is preferred
- must have great and easy-going personality – standalone position, working directly with employees, contractors and C-Suite members

description:
Looking for a new opportunity? This growing company's Help Desk Analyst position in the High Tech - Pharm/Biotech field might be right for you. We're seeking a self-confident, motivated person with a strong work ethic and excellent communication skills who enjoys a fast-paced, team-driven environment. We're looking for a Service Desk Analyst who can represent the Service Desk by liaising with 2nd and 3rd level teams to help transition new and changing services. This position could certainly have duties including creating knowledge articles and arranging training for other Service Desk Analysts when needed. If you're looking for work where you can handle complex end-user support issues and provide support to team members by focusing and restoring service to the end users, this job might be for you. This position absolutely must understand how the Help Desk Analyst role relates to IT projects and IT Service Management initiatives. You should also understand Incident, Problem, Change Management and other processes. We need the person in this position to know how these processes work together to provide superior support and high availability of our business. You should be prepared to cover alternative shifts when needed. For immediate consideration, please forward your resume to [email protected] 

Your responsibilities

- Meet and exceed SLA standards: Close tickets in a timely manner, while upholding customer service standards

- Maintain hardware and peripherals: Responsible for upgrading and replacing computer parts; handle documentation and asset inventory

- You'll do well in this job if you can facilitate user account management. That involves handling onboarding, change and departure processes

- Understand concepts related to networks, servers, PCs, databases, proprietary systems, etc.

- Provide guidance to Tier 1 support and team members

- Understand and utilize ITIL processes (Incident, Problem, Change, etc.) and how they are used in a corporate environment

- Troubleshoot end user issues: Provide root-cause analysis on various web and mobile applications; handle escalated tickets relating to server/network related issues 
 - Ability to multitask and attention to detail are critical

- Can work independently with minimal supervision

 - You might be a good fit for this position if you have technical skills to serve as escalation point for handling incidents and service requests related to application, operating system and other service related problems

- Strong problem solving and analytical skills

- 3+ years' of experience supporting desktop/server operating systems and technologies such as Active Directory, DNS, Exchange and VMware

- Expertise in Salesforce.com

- Linux experience

- Background in one or more programming or scripting language

- Sound written and verbal communication skills

- Adept at analyzing complex business problems, proposing effective solutions and understanding and applying business vision and direction

 - A combination of superior customer service skills and technical aptitude is required for success at this position

 - This job will often be easier if you have ITIL certification

description:
The Creative Group is looking for a post-production color correction for motion graphics, color balancing, color replacement, color sweetening, polishing final edited piece before it goes to client. 
 Job brief
We are looking for a talented video editor to assemble recorded footage into a finished project that matches director’s vision and is suitable for broadcasting.

Ultimately, as a film and video editor, you should be able to bring sight and sound together in order to tell a cohesive story

Responsibilities
Manipulate and edit film pieces in a way that is invisible to the audience
Take a brief to grasp production team’s needs and specifications
Review shooting script and raw material to create a shot decision list based on scenes’ value and contribution to continuity
Trim footage segments and put together the sequence of the film
Input music, dialogues, graphics and effects
Create rough and final cuts
Ensure logical sequencing and smooth running
Consult with stakeholders from production to post-production process
Continuously discover and implement new editing technologies and industry’s best practices to maximize efficiency.
Requirements
Proven work experience as a video editor
Solid experience with digital technology and editing software packages (e.g. Avid Media Composer, Lightworks, Premiere, After Effects and Final Cut)
Demonstrable video editing ability with a strong portfolio
Thorough knowledge of timing, motivation and continuity
Familiarity with special effects, 3D and compositing
Creative mind and storytelling skills
BS degree in film studies, cinematography or related field

description:

****FOR IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION FOR THIS JR. SECURITY ENGINEER POSITION, PLEASE EMAIL YOUR RESUME DIRECTLY TO [email protected] *****

1. 1-2 years of experience (go-getter type) ab
2. Excellent communicator, presents very well and needs someone who is confident

summary: Quality Inspector  Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. •	Verifies physical properties and size of materials such as plates, sheets, structural shapes, castings, forgings, dies, fixtures...
description:
Quality Inspector 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
•	Verifies physical properties and size of materials such as plates, sheets, structural shapes, castings, forgings, dies, fixtures, and work produced by fabricators, joiners and machines.
•	Measures angular dimensions, radii, contours, clearances, thread lead, wall thickness and other specifications.
•	Inspects, adjusts, and verifies accuracy of gauges and measuring instruments for conformance to specifications.
•	Examines defective parts to determine cause of defect and may recommend changes or modifications to defective parts to determine cause of defect and may recommend changes or modifications to process, materials, or equipment.
•	Records test data, applying statistical quality control procedures.
•	Evaluates data and writes reports to validate or indicate deviations from existing standards.
•	Recommends modifications of existing quality or production standards to achieve optimum quality within limits of equipment capability.
•	Sets up and performs destructive and nondestructive tests on materials, parts, or products to measure performance, life, or material characteristics.
•	Prepares graphs or charts of data or enters data into computer for analysis. 
 Requirements for the role:

- Applicants must hold a high school diploma or its equivalent

- Experience handling office equipment

- Ability to handle multiple tasks to prioritize needs and expedite tasks upon request

- Microsoft Windows experience

- Microsoft Office experience

- Microsoft PowerPoint experience preferred

- Sound written and verbal communication skills

- Proven flexibility to adapt to changes in procedures and job assignments

- Experience with Word and Excel

- 1 Year of Office Clerk experience a plus

- Possess strong organizational skills

If you are interested in this role, please give us at call at 603 641 9233 or email me directly at [email protected]

summary: Our client, a FinTech Company in San Francisco's Financial District, is seeking a Purchasing Clerk on an immediate basis. The responsibilities for this role include obtaining requirements by verifying, preparing, and forwarding purchase...
description:
Our client, a FinTech Company in San Francisco's Financial District, is seeking a Purchasing Clerk on an immediate basis. The responsibilities for this role include obtaining requirements by verifying, preparing, and forwarding purchase orders; verifying receipt of items; authorizing payment. Apply today by sending your resume to [email protected] 

Purchasing Clerk Job Duties:
	• Verifies purchase requisitions by comparing items requested to master list; clarifying unclear items; recommending alternatives.
	• Forwards available inventory items by verifying stock; scheduling delivery.
	• Prepares purchase orders by verifying specifications and price; obtaining recommendations from suppliers for substitute items; obtaining approval from requisitioning department.
	• Obtains purchased items by forwarding orders to suppliers; monitoring and expediting orders.
	• Verifies receipt of items by comparing items received to items ordered; resolves shipments in error with suppliers.
	• Authorizes payment for purchases by forwarding receiving documentation.
	• Provides purchasing planning and control information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends.

Purchasing Clerk Requirements:
	• 3+ years' experience in purchasing or procurement
	• Experience with vendor management 
	• Experience with procurement management software

Apply today by sending your resume to [email protected]
